<L>5979<pc>241-a<k1>aBijAta<k2>aBijAta
{#aBijAta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) <sup>1</sup> Born, produced,
<div n="lb">grown round or everywhere; comp. {#aBija#} ({%Ajayapāla:%} =
<div n="lb">{#samantAjjAta#}). <sup>2</sup> Noble, well born. <sup>3</sup> Fortunate, well fated,
<div n="lb">wealthy ({%Ajayapāla:%} = {#Danya#}). <sup>4</sup> Fit, proper. <sup>5</sup> Learned,
<div n="lb">wise. <sup>6</sup> Handsome ({%Viśva:%} = {#prAptarUpa#}). <sup>7</sup> Pure, faultless;
<div n="lb">e. g. in the {%Yoga Sūtra:%} {#kzIRavftteraBijAtasyeva maRergrahItf-#}
<div n="lb">{#grahaRagrAhyezu tatsTatadaYjanatApattiH#} ({%Bhojadeva:%} {#aBijAtasya#}
<div n="lb">{#nirmalasya#}). The {%Gaṇaratnamah.%} mentions the word in the
<div n="lb">{%Gaṇa%} {#brAhmaRAdi#} to {%Pāṇ.%} V. 1. 124.; see {#ABijAtya#}. [In the
<div n="lb">verses {%Bhagavadg.%} 16. 3. 4.: {#tejaH kzamA DftiH SOcamadroho#}
<div n="lb">{#nAtimAnitA . Bavanti saMpadaM dEvImaBi jAtasya BArata . da-#}
<div n="lb">{#mBo darpo'BimAnaSca kroDaH pAruzyameva ca . ajYAnaM cABi#}
<div n="lb">{#jAtasya pArTa saMpadamAsurIm,#} it seems more correct to take
<div n="lb">{#aBi#} as the separable preposition than as compounded with
<div n="lb">{#jAta#} i. e. ‘born in consequence of divine or demoniac fate’:
<div n="lb">{%Arjunam.:%} {#devayogyAM sAtvikIMsaMpadamaBilakzya tadABimuKyena#}
<div n="lb">{#jAtasya…AsurImaBilakzya jAtasya#} &c.; in a similar
<div n="lb">manner {%Śrīdharasvāmin, Madhusūdana,%} the {%Vivaraṇa, Sa-%}
<div n="lb">{%dānanda;%} e. g. the latter in his metrical gloss: {#SudDasattvamayI#}
<div n="lb">{#dEvI saMpattAmaBilakzya hi . puMso jAtasya vAkpuRyErete DarmA Ba-#}
<div n="lb">{#vantyapi .…rajastamomayI duzwavAsanA saMtatirmalEH . Sa-#}
<div n="lb">{#rIrAramBakAle'BivyaktA tAmaBilakzya ca . puMso jAtasya damBA-#}
<div n="lb">{#dyA dozA ete Bavanti vE#}.] E. {#aBi#} and {#jAta#}.
<LEND>
[Page241-b+ 56]

<L>5980<pc>241-b<k1>aBijAtatA<k2>aBijAtatA
{#aBijAtatA#}¦ f. ({#-tA#}) <sup>1</sup> Noble birth, nobility. <sup>2</sup> Beauty; e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Hitop.%} (where the word may have either sense): {#prasAdaH#}
<div n="lb">{#kurute patyuH saMpattiM nABijAtatA . kAlimA kAlakUwasya nApEtI-#}
<div n="lb">{#SvarasaMgamAt#} (ed. {%Johnson;%} {#nABijAtyatAm#} ed. {%Schlegel-Lassen;%}
<div n="lb">{#nABivAYCati#} ed. Seramp.). E. {#aBijAta,#} taddh. aff. {#tal#}.
<LEND>

<L>5981<pc>241-b<k1>aBijAti<k2>aBijAti

<L>5982<pc>241-b<k1>aBijiGraRa<k2>aBijiGraRa
{#aBijiGraRa#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-Ram#}) Smelling or rather touching the
<div n="lb">head with the nose, as a sign of affection; (not: kissing);
<div n="lb">e. g. {%Gobhila'%}s {%Gṛhya S.:%} {#striyAstUzRIM mUrDanyaBijiGraRam#}.
<div n="lb">E. {#jiGr#} (comp. {#GrA#}), with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#lyuw#}.
<LEND>

<L>5983<pc>241-b<k1>aBijit<k2>aBijit
{#aBijit#}¦ I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-t-t-t#}) Everywhere vic-
<div n="lb">torious, a vaidik epithet, or, as a neuter, a name of food;
<div n="lb">{%Vājas.:%} {#aBijitA tejasA tejo jinva#} ({%Mahīdh.:%} {#aBi sarvato#}
<div n="lb">{#jIyate yenetyaBijitsarvajayaheturannaM tena#}).
<div n="P">2. m. ({#-t#}) <sup>1</sup> The proper name of a Yādava prince, ac-
<div n="lb">cording to the {%Viṣṇu P.%} the father, acc. to the {%Harivanśa,%}
<div n="lb">the son, of Punarvasu. <sup>2</sup> The name of a sacrifice, forming
<div n="lb">part of the {#gavAmayana#} q. v.; comp. also {#ekAha;#} e. g. {#aTEtasyA-#}
<div n="lb">{#zwarAtrasya viSvajidaBijitAvekAhAvaBita uBayato jyotirmaDye#}
<div n="lb">{#zaqahaH paSukAmo hyetena yajeta#}. <sup>3</sup> (scil. {#yoga#}) The Yoga-or lead-
<div n="lb">ing star of the asterism {#aBijit#} (3. 1), the same as {%a%} Lyrae
<div n="lb">({%Kālasaṅkalita%} p. 353); its place is 60º or 62º N., the longi-
<div n="lb">tude of its circle of declination, according to different authori-
<div n="lb">ties, is 265º, 266º 40’, or 268º ({%Colebr. Ess.%} II. p. 341).
<div n="P">3. n. ({#-t#}) <sup>1</sup> (scil. {#nakzatra#}) The name of the twenty-
<div n="lb">second Nakshatra or asterism, consisting of three stars
<div n="lb">figured as a triangle; it does not occupy an equal portion
<div n="lb">of the ecliptic with the other twenty-six Nakshatras, but
<div n="lb">is carved out of the contiguous divisions (comp. {%Col. Ess.%}
<div n="lb">II. p. 341); viz. it is inserted sometimes between the twenty-
<div n="lb">first ({%Pūrvāṣāḍhā%}) and twenty-third asterism ({%Śravaṇā%}),
<div n="lb">in which case it takes 3º20' from the former and 1º 40’
<div n="lb">from the latter, thus consisting of 5º; it is chiefly used for
<div n="lb">astrological purposes ({%Kālasaṅkalita%} p. 353 &c.); to be born
<div n="lb">under it is auspicious ({%Koṣṭīpradīpa,%} as quoted by {%Rādhāk.:%}
<div n="lb">{#atisulalitakAntiH saMmataH sajjanAnAM nanu Bavati vinItaScA-#}
<div n="lb">{#rukIrtiH suveSaH . dvijavarasuraBakto vyaktavANmAnavaH (ºNmAnasaH ?)#}
<div n="lb">{#syAdaBijiti yadi sUtirBUpatiH svavaMSe#}); it is sacred to Vidhi
<div n="lb">or (the masc.) Brahman. <sup>2</sup> The eighth Muhūrta, the period
<div n="lb">comprising 24 minutes before and 24 after midday; see
<div n="lb">{#kutapa;#} e. g. {%Matsya Pur.%} (as quoted by {%Rādhāk.%}): {#aparAhle#}
<div n="lb">{#tu saMprApte aBijidrOhiRodaye . yadatra dIyate jantostadakzayamu-#}
<div n="lb">{#dAhftam;#} comp. also {#aBijita#}. E. {#aBi#} and {#jit#}.
<div n="P">II. m. f. n. ({#-t-t-t#}) Born under the constellation of the
<div n="lb">asterism Abhijit. E. {#aBijit#} with luk of the taddh. aff. {#aR#}.
<LEND>

<L>5984<pc>241-b<k1>aBijita<k2>aBijita
{#aBijita#}¦ 1. m. ({#-taH#}) The Yoga-or leading star of the
<div n="lb">asterism Abhijit (see {#aBijit#} I. 2. 3.); {#aBijite yoge,#}
<div n="lb">used like {#aBijite muhUrte#} ‘in the eighth Muhūrta’ (see
<div n="lb">{#aBijit#} I. 3. 2.); e. g. {%Harivanśa:%} {#ahaM tvaBijite yoge ni-#}
<div n="lb">{#SAyA yOvane sTite . arDarAtre karizyAmi garBamokzaM yaTAsuKam#}
<div n="lb">({%Rāmānanda:%} {#aBijite yoge niSAyA azwame muhUrte#}).
<div n="P">2. n. ({#-tam#}) The eighth Muhūrta; see the preceding.
<div n="lb">E. {#aBi#} and {#jita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5985<pc>241-b<k1>aBijiti<k2>aBijiti

<div n="lb">quest; (the word is udātta on the {%second%} syllable). E. {#ji#}
<div n="lb">with {#aBi,#} kṛt. aff. {#ktin#}.
<LEND>

<L>5986<pc>242-a<k1>aBijinmuhUrta<k2>aBijinmuhUrta

<L>5987<pc>242-a<k1>aBijYa<k2>aBijYa
{#aBijYa#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-jYaH-jYA-jYam#}) Knowing, under-
<div n="lb">standing, conversant with, skilled in; e. g. {%Sāṅkhyat. Kaum.:%}
<div n="lb">{#izwApUrtena dAkziRaH puruzatatvAnaBijYo hIzwApUrtakArI kAmopa-#}
<div n="lb">{#hatamanA vaDyate;#} or {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#indrajidvikramABijYo manvAno#}
<div n="lb">{#vAnaraM jitam…agAt#} &c.; when not compounded with
<div n="lb">a preceding noun, the object of knowledge stands in the
<div n="lb">genit. or locat.; thus the comm. of the {%Bhaṭṭik.%} explain
<div n="lb">{#viyogaduHKAnuBAvAnaBijYEH, viyogaduHKasya yo'nuBavaH .#}
<div n="lb">{#anuBavanam . tasyAnaBijYEH#} or {#tatrAnaBijYEH#}. E. {#jYA#} with {#aBi,#}
<div n="lb">kṛt aff. {#ka#}.
<div n="P">2. f. ({#-jYA#}) <sup>1</sup> Remembrance, recollection ({%Kāśikā:%} =
<div n="lb">{#smftiH#}); e. g. {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#nABijYA te mahArAja jezyAvaH Sakra-#}
<div n="lb">{#pAlitam…nABijYA te sayakzendraM BakzyAvo yadyamaM balAt;#}
<div n="lb">or {%Lalitav.:%} {#DyAnapAramitADarmAlokamuKaM sarvajYAnABijYotpA-#}
<div n="lb">{#dAya vikziptacittasattvaparipAcanatAyE saMvartate#}. <sup>2</sup> (In Buddhistic
<div n="lb">doctrine.) Supernatural knowledge, a supernatural faculty
<div n="lb">attached to the Arhatship; there are five, or according to
<div n="lb">some six, such faculties viz. 1. the faculty of divine sight,
<div n="lb">i. e. the faculty of seeing, without obstacle, all beings and
<div n="lb">bodies, of whatever kind, in the totality of the worlds;
<div n="lb">2. that of divine hearing, i. e. the faculty of understanding
<div n="lb">all words of joy or grief uttered by the beings, and all
<div n="lb">sounds of whatever kind uttered in all the worlds (or ‘the
<div n="lb">power to hear all sounds whether distant or near, whether
<div n="lb">made by devas or men’: {%Spence Hardy'%}s {%Eastern Monachism%});
<div n="lb">3. that of knowing the thoughts of other beings; 4. that
<div n="lb">of knowing former existences or what births have been
<div n="lb">got in former ages; 5. magic power or the power to
<div n="lb">assume any shape, to pass without obstacle over seas and
<div n="lb">mountains, and to disappear from one world for the sake
<div n="lb">of reappearing in another; to these some add: 6. {%āśra-%}
<div n="lb">{%vakshaya,%} (which according to {%Burnouf%} probably means)
<div n="lb">the power of destroying defects or vices. (See {%Burnouf'%}s
<div n="lb">{%Lotus de la bonne loi%} p. 820 seqq.; there is a difference be-
<div n="lb">tween this enumeration and that of {%Hardy%} in his {%Eastern%}
<div n="lb">{%Monachism%} (p. 284): he has but five {%abhijnās,%} identifies the
<div n="lb">magic power and the {%āśravakṣaya%} without defining how-
<div n="lb">ever either term, omits the first (the faculty of divine
<div n="lb">sight) and has an {%abhijnā%} not named by {%Burnouf:%} the
<div n="lb">power of knowing what births will be received in fu-
<div n="lb">ture ages). Compare {#zaqaBijYa#}. E. {#jYA#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt
<div n="lb">aff. {#aN;#} (but meaning 2. is probably better analyzed
<div n="lb">{#aBi#} and {#jYA#}).
<LEND>

<L>5988<pc>242-a<k1>aBijYAna<k2>aBijYAna
{#aBijYAna#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) <sup>1</sup> Recollection, remembrance.
<div n="lb"><sup>2</sup> Recognition. <sup>3</sup> A sign or token of recognition; e. g. in
<div n="lb">the {%Anukram.%} of the {%Rāmāyaṇa:%} {#saMBAzaRaM ca mETilyA aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#jYAnasya cArpaRam;#} or {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#aBijYAnaM gfhItvA te#} (scil.
<div n="lb">{#vAnarAH#}) {#samutpeturnaBastalam;#} or {#ayaM mETilyaBijYAnaM kAkutsTa-#}
<div n="lb">{#syANgurIyakaH#}. <sup>4</sup> The dark portion in the moon's disk. [A
<div n="lb">nom. plur. masc. {#aBijYAnAH#} is mentioned by {%Langlois%} in
<div n="lb">his tranel. of the {%Harivanśa%} as a v. 1. of {#aBiglAna#} q. v.]
<div n="lb">E. {#jYA#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#lyuw#}.
<LEND>

<L>5993<pc>242-b<k1>aBitas<k2>aBitas
{#aBitas#}¦ ind. (used absolutely or with a noun in the accusa-
<div n="lb">tive) <sup>1</sup> Before, in the presence of, towards; e. g. {%Kirātārj.:%}
<div n="lb">{#vyaktoditasmitamayUKaviBAsitozWastizWanmuneraBimuKaM sa vikIrRa-#}
<div n="lb">{#DAmnaH . tanvantamidDamaBito gurumaMSujAlaM lakzmImuvAha sakalasya#}
<div n="lb">{#SaSANkamUrteH#} ({%Mallin.:%} {#aBito'BimuKaM tizWata iti SezaH#}).
<div n="lb"><sup>2</sup> Near; e. g. {%Sāvitrī:%} {#aBitaScAgataM premRA pratyAKyAtuM na mArha-#}
<div n="lb">{#si#}. <sup>3</sup> On both sides; e. g. {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#nirAkarizRavo BAnuM#}
<div n="lb">{#divaM vartizRavo'BitaH . alaMkarizRavo BAntastaqitvantaScari-#}
<div n="lb">{#zRavaH#} ({%Jayam.:%} {#divamaBito vartizRavaH…pUrvapaScimayorvarta-#}
<div n="lb">{#nahetutvAt#}); or {#parijanamaBito vilokya dAhaM daSavadanaH pra-#}
<div n="lb">{#dideSa vAnarasya#} ({%Jayam.:%} = {#uBayapArSvasTitAn#}); comp. also
<div n="lb">the quotation s. v. {#aBijit#} I. 2. 2. where {%Mādhava%} explains
<div n="lb">{#viSvajidaBijitAvekAhAvaBitaH#} thus: {#AdO viSvajit . ante#}
<div n="lb">{#'BijidityarTaH;#} i. e. in the beginning--at the end; comp.
<div n="lb">also {#aBitoBAva#}. <sup>4</sup> On all sides, every-where; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%}
<div n="lb">{#samatra gAvo'Bito'navanteheha#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#aBitaH = sarvataH#});
<div n="lb">or {%Vājas.:%} {#apAM pfzWamasi yoniragneH samudramaBitaH pinvamAnam#}
<div n="lb">({%Mahīdh.:%} {#samudramaBitaH . udakasya paritaH#}). <sup>5</sup> Completely,
<div n="lb">throughout; e. g. {%Svāmin%} on the {%Amarak.:%} {#ApnotyaBito rajaH;#}
<div n="lb">or {%Bharata%} on the same: {#aBito vanadAhaH#}. <sup>6</sup> Quick; e. g. {%Bha-%}
<div n="lb">{%rata%} on the {%Amarak.:%} {#gacCABitaH#}. E. {#aBi,#} taddh. aff. {#tasil#}.
<LEND>

<L>5994<pc>242-b<k1>aBitAqita<k2>aBitAqita

<L>5995<pc>242-b<k1>aBitApa<k2>aBitApa
{#aBitApa#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-paH#}) <sup>1</sup> Extreme heat, surrounding heat;
<div n="lb">e. g. {%Nalod.:%} {#mfgakulamArasadAviSramamaBitApAturo mamAra sa-#}
<div n="lb">{#dAviH#} (comm. {#aBi samantato yastApaH#}). <sup>2</sup> Great pain (phy-
<div n="lb">sically or morally). E. {#aBi#} and {#tApa#}.
<LEND>

<L>6018<pc>243-a<k1>aBidroha<k2>aBidroha
{#aBidroha#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-haH#}) <sup>1</sup> Offence, injury, oppression;

<div n="lb">that it is an apposition to {#yadidam#} and that the combina-
<div n="lb">tion is a poetical liberty). <sup>2</sup> Abuse, curse; e. g. {%Manu:%} {#nA-#}

<L>6019<pc>243-b<k1>aBiDarma<k2>aBiDarma
{#aBiDarma#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-rmaH#}) (In Buddhistic doctrine.) The mani-
<div n="lb">fested or revealed truth; ({%Abhidharmakośa,%} as quoted in
<div n="lb">{%Burnouf'%}s {%Introd.%} p. 40: = {#aBimuKo DarmaH;#} therefore not to be
<div n="lb">rendered: the ‘supreme law’; {#Darma#} has been translated here
<div n="lb">‘truth’, instead of ‘law’, in conformity with the judicious
<div n="lb">remark of {%Spence Hardy, East. Mon.%} p. 167); i. e. the Bud-
<div n="lb">dhistic dogmas and metaphysics, as laid down in the {#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#BiDarmapiwaka#} q. v.--The first redaction of the Abhidharma
<div n="lb">is ascribed to {%Kāśyapa%} or {%Mahā-Kaśyapa,%} the principal
<div n="lb">disciple of {%Śākya Muni;%} but the redaction of the whole col-
<div n="lb">lection of works on this subject seems to belong to different
<div n="lb">periods the last of which precedes the third Buddhistic
<div n="lb">synod; (see {%Lassen'%}s {%Ind. Alt.%} vol. II. p. 458). {%Hodgson%} re-
<div n="lb">lates of four great {%Nepalese%} schools divided on account of
<div n="lb">their views on the Abhidharma: the {%Svābhāvika, Aiśvarika,%}
<div n="lb">{%Kārmika%} and {%Yātnika%} (see {%Burnouf'%}s {%Introd.%} p. 441 and the
<div n="lb">quotation given there); {%Csoma de Körös%} speaks of four
<div n="lb">other {%Tibetian%} schools which are divided and subdivided
<div n="lb">into various sects: 1. the {%Vaibhāṣikās%} which comprise four
<div n="lb">sects: {%a.%} one founded by {%Rāhula,%} the son of Śākya, and
<div n="lb">subdivided at the period of the third synod into seven sects:
<div n="lb">the Mūla-sarvāsti-vādās, Kāśyapīyās, Mahīśāsakās, Dhar-
<div n="lb">maguptās, Bahuśrutīyās, Tāmraśātīyās and Vibhādyavā-
<div n="lb">dinas; {%b.%} one founded by {%Kāśyapa,%} a Brāhmaṇa, and sub-
<div n="lb">divided into six sects, five of which, bearing the collective
<div n="lb">name of Mahāsaṅghikās, were known at the time of the
<div n="lb">third synod: the Pūrvaśailās, Avaraśailās, Haimavatās,
<div n="lb">Lokottaravādinas and Prajnaptivādinas; {%c.%} one founded by
<div n="lb">{%Upāli,%} a Śūdra, and having the surname Sammatās, sub-
<div n="lb">divided into three sects: the Kaurmakullakās (?), Āvan-
<div n="lb">tikās and Vātsīputrīyās; {%d.%} one founded by {%Kātyāyana,%} a
<div n="lb">Śūdra, and subdivided also into three sects: the Mahāvi-
<div n="lb">hāravāsinas, Jyetavanīyās and Abhayagirivāsinas; 2. the
<div n="lb">{%Sautrāntikās%} with two sects; 3. the {%Yogāchārās,%} founded by
<div n="lb">{%Āryasaṅgha%} and divided into nine sects; 4. the {%Mādhyami-%}
<div n="lb">{%kās%} owing their origin to {%Nāgārjuna%} who lived about 400
<div n="lb">years after the Buddha, divided into two sects the founders
<div n="lb">of which are probably {%Āryadeva%} and {%Buddhapālita.%} (For
<div n="lb">these sects and the doctrine itself see {%Burnouf'%}s {%Introd.%}
<div n="lb">p. 437 ff., {%Lassen'%}s {%Ind. Alt.%} II. p. 456 ff.; also {%Spence Hardy'%}s
<div n="lb">{%East. Mon.%} where a legend, related p. 197, conveys an idea
<div n="lb">of the great merit supposed to be acquired by the study of
<div n="lb">the Abhidharma.) E. {#aBi#} and {#Darma#}.
<LEND>

<L>6020<pc>243-b<k1>aBiDarmakoSa<k2>aBiDarmakoSa
{#aBiDarmakoSa#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-SaH#}) The name of a Buddhistic
<div n="lb">work on the Abhidharma (see the preceding and the fol-
<div n="lb">lowing), by Vasubandhu; with a commentary called {#aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#DarmakoSavyAKyA#}. E. {#aBiDarma#} and {#koSa#}.
<LEND>

<L>6021<pc>243-b<k1>aBiDarmapiwaka<k2>aBiDarmapiwaka
{#aBiDarmapiwaka#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-kaH#}) ‘The basket of the revealed
<div n="lb">truth’: the name of one of the three collections which com-
<div n="lb">prise the sacred books of the Buddhists; (for the two others
[Page244-a+ 56]
<div n="lb">see {#sUtrapiwaka#} and {#vinayapiwaka#}); the instructions contained
<div n="lb">in it were addressed by the Buddha to the Devas and
<div n="lb">Brahmas of the celestial worlds (while those in the {%Sūtra-%}
<div n="lb">{%piṭaka%} were addressed to the laity and those in the {%Vinayap.%}
<div n="lb">to the priests); its redaction however is not ascribed to
<div n="lb">Sākya Muni, but to his principal disciple {%Kāśyapa,%} the
<div n="lb">chief of the first Buddhistic synod. It contains seven sections,
<div n="lb">the text with 96, 250 stanzas, the commentaries with 30,000,
<div n="lb">consisting, therefore, in the whole of 126,250 stanzas; its
<div n="lb">best representative is the work called {%Prajnāpāramitā;%}
<div n="lb">(comp. {%Spence Hardy'%}s {%East. Mon.%} p. 170 with the quot.
<div n="lb">given there, and those s. v. {#aBiDarma#}). E. {#aBiDarma#} and {#piwaka#}.
<LEND>

<div n="lb">{#aBi#} and {#DarzaRa#}.

<L>6023<pc>244-a<k1>aBiDA<k2>aBiDA
{#aBiDA#}¦ I. Tatpur. m. f. ({#-DAH-DAH#}) (ved.) Invoked, praised;
<div n="lb">{%Vājas.:%} {#aBiDA asi Buvanamasi#} ({%Mahīdh.:%} {#he aSva yastvama-#}
<div n="lb">{#BiDA asi . aBiDIyate stUyata ityaBiDAH#}). E. {#DA#} with
<div n="lb">{#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#kvip#}.
<div n="P">II. Tatpur. f. ({#-DA#}) <sup>1</sup> A name, an appellation; e. g. {#iti SrI-#}
<div n="lb">{#kAlidAsaviracitaM meGadUtABiDaM mahAkAvyaM saMpUrRam;#} or {%Rāja-%}
<div n="lb">{%tar.:%} {#kAvyadevyaBiDA SUravaDUH;#} or {#kasyAnyasyABiDADvaMsi yaTA#}
<div n="lb">{#SaNkaravarmaRaH#} ‘whose name else has been made to disappear
<div n="lb">({#aBiDA-aDvaMsi#}) like that of Śaṅkaravarman ?’. <sup>2</sup> The literal
<div n="lb">or original signification of a word; defined by the rhetorical
<div n="lb">works as the power of a word to express that sense which it
<div n="lb">has by common consent, or conventionally, whether the word
<div n="lb">imply the notion of class ({#jAti,#} as cow &c.) or of quality
<div n="lb">({#guRa,#} as white &c.) or of action ({#kriyA,#} as cooking &c.), or
<div n="lb">whether it be the name of an individual ({#dravya#} i. e. a proper
<div n="lb">name or {#saMjYA,#} as Hari &c.); the term {%‘conventional sense’%}
<div n="lb">is not restricted in this definition to the sense of such words
<div n="lb">as instanced before, but applies also e. g. to such meanings
<div n="lb">as the meaning ‘bee’ of {#maDukara,#} since this word has the
<div n="lb">latter sense occasionally, or to the explanations of com-
<div n="lb">mentators, although the word commented upon may have
<div n="lb">the given sense only in a particular passage; the term does
<div n="lb">not extend, however, to the elliptical and constructive or
<div n="lb">contingent bearing of a word, these latter being considered
<div n="lb">as the two other powers which a word may possess; (see
<div n="lb">{#lakzaRA#} and {#vyaYjanA#}); {%Sāhityad.:%} {#vAcyo'rTo'BiDayA boDyo#}
<div n="lb">{#lakzyo lakzaRayA mataH . vyaNgyo vyaYjanayA tAH syustisraH Sabdasya#}
<div n="lb">{#SaktayaH .. tatra saMketitArTasya boDanAdagrimABiDA . saMketo gf-#}
<div n="lb">{#hyate jAtO guRadravyakriyAsu ca;#} {%Kāvyaprak.:%} {#sAkzAtsaMketitaM#}
<div n="lb">{#yo'rTamaBiDatte sa vAcakaH . saMketitaScaturBedo jAtyAdirjAti-#}
<div n="lb">{#reva vA . sa muKyo'rTastatra muKyo vyApAro'syABiDocyate;#}
<div n="lb">or {%the same:%} {#ata evABiDApucCaBUtA setyAhuH#} ({#sA#} i. e. {#la-#}
<div n="lb">{#kzaRA#}). <sup>3</sup> A sound; {%Śabdaratn.:%} {#SabdanirGozanirhrAdanisvAna-#}
<div n="lb">{#svAnanisvanAH…virAvanAdahrAsAH syuraBiDA cA-#}
<div n="lb">{#BiDAnakam . taTA kuhuritaM ceti SabdaparyAya IritaH#}. Comp.
<div n="lb">{#aBiDAna#}. E. {#DA#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#aN#}.
<LEND>

<L>6024<pc>244-a<k1>aBiDAtavya<k2>aBiDAtavya
{#aBiDAtavya#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-vyaH-vyA-vyam#}) To be named,
<div n="lb">to be expressed; comp. {#aBiDAnIya#} and {#aBiDeya#}. E. {#DA#}
<div n="lb">with {#aBi,#} kṛtya aff. {#tavya#}.
<LEND>

<L>6025<pc>244-a<k1>aBiDAna<k2>aBiDAna
{#aBiDAna#}¦ Tatpur. 1. n. ({#-nam#}) <sup>1</sup> Naming, telling, expressing;
<div n="lb">e. g. in the {%Vārtt.%} to {%Pāṇ.:%} {#kzubDaM manTABiDAna iti vaktavyam;#}
<div n="lb">or {#svAntaM mano'BiDAna iti vaktavyam;#} or {#DvAntaM mano'Bi-#}
[Page244-b+ 56]
<div n="lb">{#DAna iti vaktavyam;#} or {#avAtABiDAna iti vaktavyam;#} or {%Pa-%}
<div n="lb">{%tanj.%} to {%Pāṇ.:%} {#kaH punarvIpsArTaH . anavayavABiDAnaM vIpsArTaH .#}
<div n="lb">{#anavayavena dravyARAmaBiDAnameza vIpsArTaH;#} or in the {%Nyāya%}
<div n="lb">{%S.:%} {#arTAdApannasya svaSabdena punaraBiDAnam;#} or in the {%Mī-%}
<div n="lb">{%mānsā S.:%} {#guRABiDAnAtsarvArTamaBiDAnam;#} or {%Sāhityad.:%}
<div n="lb">{#(nAndI) pUrvaraNgasya raNgadvArABiDAnamaNgamityucyate#}.--In writ-
<div n="lb">ings on the {%Mīmānsā philosophy%} {#aBiDAna#} or {#aBiDAyakatva#}
<div n="lb">are used sometimes in opposition to {#viDAyakatva,#} when the
<div n="lb">former imply such expressions or passages in the Vedas
<div n="lb">as do not contain a {#viDi#} or injunction, but merely a
<div n="lb">description or explanation; the word becomes in such cases
<div n="lb">a synonyme of {#anuvAda#} q. v.; e. g. {%Mīmānsā S.:%} {#viDi-#}
<div n="lb">{#mantrayorEkArTyamEkaSabdyAt . api vA prayogasAmarTyAnmantro#}
<div n="lb">{#'BiDAnavAcI syAt;#} {%Jaiminīyanyāyam.:%} {#devAMSca yABiryajata#}
<div n="lb">{#ityAKyAtaM tu mantragam . viDAyakaM na vAnyena samatvAttadviDA-#}
<div n="lb">{#yakam . yacCabdAdeH kzIRaSaktirna viDistriviDaM tataH . A-#}
<div n="lb">{#KyAtamaBiDAnaM ca praDAnaguRakarmaRI#} ({%comm.:%} {#ayaM mantra A-#}
<div n="lb">{#mnAyate . devAMSca yABiryajate dadAti ca jyogittABiH sacate#}
<div n="lb">{#gopatiH saheti .…tatra yaTA brAhmaRagatamAKyAtapadaM pra-#}
<div n="lb">{#DAnaguRakarmaRoranyatarasya viDAyakam . taTA mantragatamapIti#}
<div n="lb">{#cet .. mEvam . yacCabdAdinA viDiSakteH kzIRatvAt . sati hi#}
<div n="lb">{#yacCabde tasya vAkyasyAnuvAdakatvaM pratIyate . na tu viDAyaka-#}
<div n="lb">{#tvam .…tasmAdAKyAtasya praDAnakarmaviDAyakatvaM guRakarma-#}
<div n="lb">{#viDAyakatvaM cetyevaM dvAveva prakArO na BavataH . kiMtvaBiDAyaka-#}
<div n="lb">{#tvamityapyasti tftIyaH prakAraH . tato na mantragatAKyAtasya vi-#}
<div n="lb">{#DAyakatvam#}).--Comp. also {#bahvaBiDAna#} (in the sense of {#ba-#}
<div n="lb">{#huvacana#}). <sup>2</sup> A proposition, a rule, an axiom; (this seems
<div n="lb">to be the sense of the word in the {%comm.%} on the {%Vājas.%}
<div n="lb">{%Prātiś.%} 4. 141., where {#aBiDAna#} would imply the axiom or
<div n="lb">law taught by the Sūtra; comp. the preceding words {#tasyE-#}
<div n="lb">{#taducyate#}). <sup>3</sup> The same as {#aBiDA#} II. 2.; e. g. {%Kāvyapr.:%} {#lakza-#}
<div n="lb">{#RAtmakameva Dvananam . tadanugamena tasya darSanAt . na ca tadanu-#}
<div n="lb">{#gatameva . aBiDAnAvalambanenApi tasya BAvAnna coBayAnusAryeva#}.
<div n="lb"><sup>4</sup> The being named, the being expressed; e. g. in the {%Nyāya%}
<div n="lb">{%S.:%} {#kAraRadravyasya pradeSaSabdenABiDAnAt;#} or in the {%Vedānta%}
<div n="lb">{%S.:%} {#jyotiScaraRABiDAnAt;#} or {#Cando'BiDAnAnneti cenna#} &c.;
<div n="lb">or {#suKaviSizwABiDAnAdeva ca;#} or {%Jayamangala%} in the comm.
<div n="lb">on the {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#samaSabdenopamAyA aBiDAnAt#} &c.; or
<div n="lb">{%Bharatas.%} in his comm. on the same: {#vfdDikriyayostulyakA-#}
<div n="lb">{#layorvavfDa ityanenABiDAnAt#}. <sup>5</sup> Speech, discourse. <sup>6</sup> A vo-
<div n="lb">cabulary; e. g. {%Vopad.:%} {#kfttadDitasamAsAnAmaBiDAnaM niyA-#}
<div n="lb">{#makam;#} comp. also {%Colebr. Ess.%} II. p. 52.
<div n="P">2. m. n. ({#-naH-nam#}) <sup>1</sup> A name, an appellation; e. g. {%Ki-%}
<div n="lb">{%rātārj.:%} {#tavABiDAnAdvyaTate natAnanaH#} ({%Mallin.:%} {#tavABiDAnA-#}
<div n="lb">{#nnAmaDeyAnnAmaDeyasmaraRAt#}); or {%Śiśupālab.:%} {#jagati sumanasa-#}
<div n="lb">{#stadAdi nUnaM daDati parisPuwamarTato'BiDAnam;#} or {%Jaimini%}
<div n="lb">{%Sūtra:%} {#uktaM kriyABiDAnaM syAttadaBAve prasidDaM syAt;#} comp.
<div n="lb">also the instance s. v. {#aBicAramantra#}. <sup>2</sup> A word; e. g. the
<div n="lb">{%Ṭīkā%} on the {%Sāhityad.:%} {#anvitABiDAnavAdino#} (i. e. those
<div n="lb">who argue that the words of a sentence are logically con-
<div n="lb">nected) {#mImAMsakaguravastu kriyAkArakayoH praTamata evAnvaya-#}
<div n="lb">{#boDo jAyate tataH SaktigrahaH;#} or {%Kāvyapr.:%} {#himapayaHSaNkA-#}
<div n="lb">{#dyASrayezu paramArTato Binnezu SuklAdizu yadvaSena SuklaH Sukla i-#}
<div n="lb">{#tyAdyaBinnABiDAnapratyayotpattiH;#} or {%Suśruta:%} {#vyaktABiDAnama-#}
<div n="lb">{#Kilena viDiM niboDa#} &c.; or {%Manu:%} {#strIRAM…ASIrvA-#}
<div n="lb">{#dABiDAnavat#} (scil. {#nAmaDeyam#}). <sup>3</sup> A sound (?); comp. {#aBiDA#}
[Page245-a+ 56]
<div n="lb">II. 3. and the following article. [The double gender of the word
<div n="lb">is mentioned by the {%Siddhāntak.,%} but apparently restricted
<div n="lb">to the meanings given under 2., for the {%Gaṇaratnam.%} which
<div n="lb">mentions the word in the Gaṇa {#arDarcAdi#}--{%Pāṇ.%} II. 4. 31.
<div n="lb">--explains it {#aBiDAnaM#} or {#aBiDAno nAma SabdaSca#}.]
<div n="P">3. f. ({#-nI#}) (ved.) A rope, a halter; (thus explained by
<div n="lb">{%Kaiyyaṭa%} when speaking of the meanings of {#DA#} with {#aBi,#}
<div n="lb">viz. {#aBipUrvastAvaddaDAtirbanDanoccAraRapratipAdanezu vartate . a-#}
<div n="lb">{#SvABiDAnImAdatta ityatra banDanavfttiH#} &c.). E. {#DA#} with {#aBi,#}
<div n="lb">kṛt aff. {#lyuw#}.
<LEND>

<L>6027<pc>245-a<k1>aBiDAnacintAmaRi<k2>aBiDAnacintAmaRi

<div n="lb">every word desired’; the name of the first part of {%Hema-%}
<div n="lb">{%chandra'%}s vocabulary or of the portion containing the syn-
<div n="lb">onymes; the work is commented upon by {%Hemachandra%}
<div n="lb">himself and by {%Vallabhagaṇi.%} (The latter portion of Hema-
<div n="lb">chandra's vocabulary bears the title {%Anekārthasaṅgraha%} or
<div n="lb">{%Nānārthasaṅgraha%} and is similar to, but not identical with,
<div n="lb">{%Maheśvara'%}s {%Viśvaprakāśa;%} there must have existed or may
<div n="lb">still exist an extensive commentary on it, probably by He-
<div n="lb">machandra himself, as may be concluded from a single Ms.
<div n="lb">leaf which is happily preserved of it in the British Museum.)
<div n="lb">E. {#aBiDAna#} and {#cintAmaRi#}.
<LEND>

<L>6050<pc>246-a<k1>aBiDyA<k2>aBiDyA
{#aBiDyA#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-DyA#}) <sup>1</sup> Desire, wish; e. g. (of Brahman)
<div n="lb">{%Vedānta S.:%} {#aBiDyopadeSAcca#} ({%Śaṅkara:%} {#aBiDyopadeSaScA-#}
<div n="lb">{#tmanaH kartftvaprakftitve gamayati so'kAmayata bahu syAM prajAye-#}
<div n="lb">{#yeti tadEkzateti ca . tatrABiDyAnapUrvikAyAH svAtantpyapravftteH#}
<div n="lb">{#karteti gamyate . bahu syAmiti pratyagAtmavizayatvAt . bahuBava-#}
<div n="lb">{#nABiDyAnasya prakftirityapi gamyate;#} {%Anūpanār.:%} {#so'kAmayata#}
<div n="lb">{#bahu syAmiti svasya bahutvasaMkalpo'BiDyA#} &c.). See {#aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#DyAna#}. <sup>2</sup> Coveting another's property (in employing charms
<div n="lb">or in scheming, or by means of a robbery). <sup>3</sup> Desire of
<div n="lb">taking, in general. [Several comm. on the {%Amarak.%} give
<div n="lb">merely the meaning: coveting another's property: {#paraDana-#}
<div n="lb">{#spfhA#} or {#paradravye vizayaspfhA;#} but {%Svāmin:%} {#cintApUrvaM parasva-#}
<div n="lb">{#lipsA;#} {%Rāyamukuṭa:%} {#aBicAre'BiDyAnamaBiDyA .…#}
<div n="lb">{#parasvavizaye vizayitayA spfhA vizayispfhABiDyocyate . viza-#}
<div n="lb">{#yaspfheti pAWe vizayena cOryAdinA spfhetyarTaH;#} similarly {%Bha-%}
<div n="lb">{%ratamalla;%} the {%Kaumudī:%} {#jiGfkzAmAtre'pyaBiDyA;#} {%Vallabha-%}
<div n="lb">{%gaṇi%} on {%Hemach.:%} {#parasvehA dravyavizayavAYCA . parasve vizaya-#}
<div n="lb">{#spfhetyeko dozaH . cintApUrvaM paradravyavAYCetyarTaH . yatkAtyaH .#}
<div n="lb">{#vizayaprArTanABiDyA#}.] E. {#DyE#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#aN#}.
<LEND>

<L>6063<pc>246-b<k1>aBinaya<k2>aBinaya
{#aBinaya#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. ({#-yaH#}) Action and postures expressive
<div n="lb">of sentiment, especially when exhibited in a dramatic per-
<div n="lb">formance; dramatic representation; it is fourfold: {#ANgika#}
<div n="lb">or conveyed by bodily action, as by attitude, gesture &c.,
<div n="lb">{#vAcika#} by speech, {#AhArya#} by dress, decorations &c. and
<div n="lb">{#sAttvika#} by the spontaneous manifestation of feelings, as
<div n="lb">by perspiration, horripilation, inarticulate speech &c.; e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Vikramorv.:%} {#lalitABinayaM tamadya BartA marutAM drazwumanAH sa-#}
<div n="lb">{#lokapAlaH;#} or a quotation by the {%Sāhityad.:%} {#yasmAdaBinayo#}
<div n="lb">{#hyatra prATamyAdavatAryate . raNgadvAramato jYeyaM vAgaNgABinayA-#}
<div n="lb">{#tmakam#}. The term {#aBinaya#} as applying merely to the {%means%}
<div n="lb">of a dramatic representation is therefore distinct from the
<div n="lb">term {#rUpaka#} (and its subdivisions) q. v. which belongs to the
<div n="lb">{%contents%} of the representation or to the drama itself, both
<div n="lb">being the categories which distinguish the ‘poem to be
<div n="lb">seen’ from the ‘poem to be heard’; {%Sāhityad.:%} {#dfSyaSravya-#}
<div n="lb">{#tvaBedena punaH kAvyaM dviDA matam . dfSyaM tatrABineyaM tadrUpAro-#}
[Page247-a+ 56]
<div n="lb">{#pAttu rUpakam . BavedaBinayo'vasTAnukAraH sa caturviDaH . A-#}
<div n="lb">{#Ngiko vAcikaScEvamAhAryaH sAttvikastaTA;#} (the {%Amarak.%} dis-
<div n="lb">tinguishes the {#aBinaya#} only as {#ANgika#} and {#sAttvika;#} {%He-%}
<div n="lb">{%mach.%} has the same definition as the {%Sāhityad.%}).
<div n="P">[2. n. ({#-yam#}) See the remark s. v. {#aBibala#}.] E. {#nI#} with
<div n="lb">{#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#ac;#} {%Saṅgītadarpaṇa:%} {#aBipUrvastu RIYDAtu-#}
<div n="lb">{#rABimuKyArTanirRaye . asmAtprayogaM nayati tasmAdaBinayaH smftaH#}.
<LEND>

<L>6064<pc>247-a<k1>aBinava<k2>aBinava

<div n="lb">{#aBinavAnAM maDUkapuzpARAM saMBavaH#}. Comp. {#aBinavaSAkawA-#}

<L>6065<pc>247-a<k1>aBinavacandrArGaviDi<k2>aBinavacandrArGaviDi
{#aBinavacandrArGaviDi#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-DiH#}) The ceremony of
<div n="lb">presenting the idols of the new moon and of his wife Ro-
<div n="lb">hiṇī, placed on the ground in a circle of cowdung, with
<div n="lb">flowers, sandal, perfumes, a lamp, fried grain, water,
<div n="lb">young Dūrvā grass ornamented with jewels, curdled milk
<div n="lb">and white cloth, while reciting the prayer: ‘thou art ever
<div n="lb">new at the end of the month, born again and again; in-
<div n="lb">crease for my benefit; hail! hail to thee, Lord of the Soma!’;
<div n="lb">the time of the ceremony is the evening twilight of the
<div n="lb">second day of the light half of every month (i. e. of the
<div n="lb">second day of the fifteen days of the moon's increase),
<div n="lb">when the sun stands in the west with twelve degrees of its
<div n="lb">circumference. The rite is performed by a Kshatriya with
<div n="lb">his house chaplain, and great boons are promised to him
<div n="lb">in this and the future world for the regular fulfillment of
<div n="lb">this act of piety; (according to the {%Bhavishyottara-Purāṇa,%}
<div n="lb">where the principal passage runs thus: {#raverdvAdaSaBirBAgErvA-#}
<div n="lb">{#ruRyAM dfSyate yadi . pradozasamaye pArTa#} (Kṛṣṇa speaks to
<div n="lb">Arjuna) {#arGaM dadyAttadA viBo .. dvitIyAyAM site pakze saMDyA-#}
<div n="lb">{#kAle hyupasTite . saMsTApyABinavaM candraM BUmyAM gomayamaRqale ..#}
<div n="lb">{#rohiRyA sahitaM devaM candanena suSoBanam . puzpacandanaDUpESca#}
<div n="lb">{#dIpAkzatajalEH SuBEH .. dUrvANkurE ratnaDarErdaDnA#} ({%v. l.%} {#ratnaGanErdaDnA#})
<div n="lb">{#vastrESca pARqurEH#} ({%v. l.%} {#pARqavEH#}) {#. mantreRAnena rAjendraH kzatriyaH#}
<div n="lb">{#sapurohitaH#} (Mss. {#ºtam#}) {#.. navo navo'si mAsAnte jAyamAnaH#}
<div n="lb">{#punaH punaH . ApyAyasva ca me'pyevaM somarAja namo namaH .. a-#}
<div n="lb">{#nena viDinA cArGaM sarvakAmapradaM SuBam . yaH prayacCati kOnteya#}
<div n="lb">{#mAsi mAsi samAhitaH .. sa kIrtyA yaSasA yuktaH kAntyA ca Buvi#}
<div n="lb">{#mAnavaH . putrapOtraparivfto goDAnyaDanasaMkulaH .. sTitvA varzaSataM#}
<div n="lb">{#martye tataH somapuraM vrajet#} &c.). E. {#aBinava-candra-arGa#} and {#viDi#}.
<LEND>

<L>6075<pc>247-b<k1>aBiniDAna<k2>aBiniDAna
{#aBiniDAna#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) <sup>1</sup> Placing over, putting over;
<div n="lb">e. g. {%Kātyāy. Śrautas.:%} {#AyurasItyuttarayAjyasTAlIM saMspfSya pu-#}
<div n="lb">{#rUravA ityaBiniDAnaM tayA;#} ({%comm.%} {#uttarAraRyA aDarAraRe-#}
<div n="lb">{#rupari niDAnaM karoti#}). <sup>2</sup> (In the {%Prātiśakhyas%}) Suppression
<div n="lb">or weakening of a sound with regard to, or on account
<div n="lb">of, scil. the influence of a preceding or following sound
<div n="lb">[the qualification {%‘with regard to’%} or {%‘on account of’%} seems
<div n="lb">to be implied by the prefix {#aBi#}], viz. <sup>a.</sup> the suppression
<div n="lb">of the vowel {#a#} through the influence of a {%preceding%} {#o#} or
<div n="lb">{#e#} (comp. {#aBinihita#}); e. g. in {#gAhamAno'dayaH#} of the word
<div n="lb">{#adayaH,#} or in {#vAle'vata#} of the word {#avata;#} <sup>b.</sup> the sup-
<div n="lb">pression or weakening of the sound or of the vibration of
<div n="lb">the voice which naturally follows the pronunciation of a
<div n="lb">consonant, if such a consonant is {%followed%} by, and has made
<div n="lb">{%sandhi%} with, another consonant; according to the {%Ṛgv.%}
<div n="lb">{%Prātiś.,%} such a sound or the vibration of the voice is {%sup-%}
<div n="lb">{%pressed,%} if the consonant is surd ({#ka, ca#} &c.); it is {%weakened,%}
<div n="lb">if the consonant is sonant ({#ga, ja#} &c.) and the sound which
<div n="lb">{%remains,%} after such weakening is called {#Druva#} (q. v.). This
<div n="lb">suppression or weakening of the vibration of the voice,
<div n="lb">however, takes place only under the following restrictions:
<div n="lb">1. in the pronunciation of a {#sparSa#} or {#antaHsTA#} (except {#r#}),
[Page248-a+ 56]
<div n="lb">if it is followed by a {#sparSa;#} e. g. in {#arvAgdevaH#} or in {#ulkAm;#}
<div n="lb">2. of a {#sparSa,#} if it stands in a pause; e. g. in {#vAk;#} 3. of an
<div n="lb">{#antaHsTA,#} if it is followed by another similar {#antaHsTA;#}
<div n="lb">e. g. in {#tavvaM~H;#} 4 of {#l,#} if it is followed by an {#Uzman;#} e. g.
<div n="lb">in {#SatavalSaH;#} 5. of {#k#} in {#akKyat;#} 6. of {#p#} in {#virapsI;#} 7. of
<div n="lb">a {#sparSa#} except {#m#} (i. e. {#k#} till {#B#}), if it is followed by {#y,#}
<div n="lb">{#r, v#} or an {#Uzman;#} e. g. in {#yadyat, tadrAsaBaH, yAnvaH, arvA-#}
<div n="lb">{#kSaPO;#} (the latter cases 4-7. only in the theory of the {%Śā-%}
<div n="lb">{%kalas%}). These general rules are subject to exceptions and
<div n="lb">restrictions, and even as such they are not universally re-
<div n="lb">cognized; {%Śaunaka,%} for instance, says, that {%Vyāĺi%} does not
<div n="lb">recognize the {#aBiniDAna,#} {%in general,%} and admits of it only
<div n="lb">when the following consonant is doubled or if a vowel or
<div n="lb">{#r#} precede.--The {%Vājas. Prātiś.%} uses instead of the term
<div n="lb">{#aBiniDAna#} the explanation {#sTAnakaraRavimokzaH#} ‘giving up
<div n="lb">the characteristics of a consonant, viz. the organic dis-
<div n="lb">tinction and the distinction with regard to the effort of pro-
<div n="lb">nunciation’; (comp. the list in {%Pāṇ.%} I. 1. 9. where {#karaRa#}
<div n="lb">answers the {#prayatna;#} and see {%Weber'%}s ed. of this {%Prātiś. Ind.%}
<div n="lb">{%Stud.%} IV. p. 127), but applies it merely to the {#sparSa#} at the
<div n="lb">end of a word, if it is followed by another word, and in
<div n="lb">a pause.--The {%Atharvav. Prātiś.%} (quoted by {%Weber 1. c.,%}
<div n="lb">where the {%masc.%} {#aBiniDAnaH#} seems to be an error of the
<div n="lb">Berlin Ms.) admits the {#aBiniDAna#} only 1. of a {#sparSa,#} if it
<div n="lb">is followed by a {#sparSa,#} 2. of a {#sparSa#} at the end of a word or
<div n="lb">at an {#avagraha,#} 3. of {#l#} before an {#Uzman,#} 4 of {#N, Ra, na,#}
<div n="lb">before {#h#}. {%Śākalya,%} in the cases 4-7. mentioned above, and
<div n="lb">the {%Atharvav. Prātiś.%} in its enumeration do not consider
<div n="lb">two consonants, the first of which suffers the {%abhinidhāna,%}
<div n="lb">as {#saMyukta#} or combined consonants ({%Śaunaka:%} {#asaMyuktaM SA-#}
<div n="lb">{#kalam;#} {%Atharvav. Pr.:%} {#ato'nyatsaMyuktam ‘saMyukta#} is a com-
<div n="lb">bination of consonants other than that in the preceding
<div n="lb">cases’); i. e. they assume such a stoppage of the voice as
<div n="lb">to prevent two consonants to sound together; but {%Śaunaka%}
<div n="lb">does not seem to go so far, for he quotes {%Śākalya%} apparently
<div n="lb">for the sake of recording his dissent from the opinion of
<div n="lb">the latter. The distinction is probably owing to the dif-
<div n="lb">ference in the observation, by the different grammarians,
<div n="lb">of the phenomena of pronunciation; the supposition of {%Mr.%}
<div n="lb">{%Regnier%} ({%Journ. Asiat.%} 1857, p. 230), that there is a twofold
<div n="lb">{%abhinidhāna,%} the one applying to the consonantic groups
<div n="lb">which are the {%natural%} effect of the sandhi, the other to such
<div n="lb">groups as are produced by the {%krama,%} is very ingenious,
<div n="lb">but does not necessarily follow from the text of this {%Prātiś.%}
<div n="lb">(I. 1. 6. and 7.); for similar differences of opinion in the theory
<div n="lb">on the pronunciation of consonantic groups, arising ob-
<div n="lb">viously from different observations, may be gathered also
<div n="lb">from the Sūtras of Pāṇini. [In the preceding explanation
<div n="lb">the term {#sparSa#} comprises the 25 consonants {#ka-Na, ca-Ya,#}
<div n="lb">{#wa-Ra, ta-na#} and {#pa-ma;#} the term {#Uzman#} (q. v.) the sibi-
<div n="lb">lants {#ha, Sa, za, sa;#} and the semivowels {#ya, ra, la, va#} are
<div n="lb">termed {#antaHsTA,#} because their position in the system of
<div n="lb">the vaidik gramm. is between the {#sparSa#} and {#Uzman;#} (s. v.
<div n="lb">{#antaHsTA#} p. 117{%a,%} 1. 49 the words ‘vowels and consonants’
<div n="lb">are a mistake for ‘{#sparSa#} and {#Uzman#}’).] E. {#DA#} with {#ni#} and
<div n="lb">{#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#lyuw#}.
<LEND>
[Page248-b+ 56]

<L>6079<pc>248-b<k1>aBinirmukta<k2>aBinirmukta
{#aBinirmukta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-ktaH-ktA-ktam#}) <sup>1</sup> Left, quitted.
<div n="lb"><sup>2</sup> One asleep at sunset. [The last meaning, given by the
<div n="lb">{%Amarak.%} and {%Hemach.,%} owes its origin probably to {%Manu%}
<div n="lb">2. 221. or a similar passage, where the word is to be joined
<div n="lb">with the word {#sUryeRa,#} both words meaning literally ‘one
<div n="lb">left by the sun’, scil. while asleep (this ellipsis resulting
<div n="lb">from the preceding verse 2. 220.); the same remark applies
<div n="lb">to the meaning {%‘one asleep at sunrise’,%} given by the Koshas
<div n="lb">to {#aByudita,#} for in {%Manu%} 2. 221. the latter word is also to
<div n="lb">be coupled with {#sUryeRa,#} when both these words mean liter-
<div n="lb">ally: ‘one {%towards%} whom the sun has risen’ (scil. while
<div n="lb">asleep), the meaning {%towards%} of {#aBi#} in {#aByudita#} resulting
<div n="lb">from the beginning of verse 220., where {#aBi#} is {%karmaprav.%}
<div n="lb">or the separable preposition, not the verbal prefix; {%Manu%}
<div n="lb">2. 220. 221.: {#taM cedaByudiyAtsUryaH SayAnaM kAmacArataH#} ({%v. l.%} {#kA-#}
<div n="lb">{#makArataH#}) {#. nimlocedvApyavijYAnAjjapannupavaseddinam .. sUryeRa#}
<div n="lb">{#hyaBinirmuktaH SayAno'ByuditaSca yaH . prAyaScittamakurvARo yu-#}
<div n="lb">{#ktaH syAnmahatEnasA;#} and comp. {%Gotama,%} as quoted by {%Kullūka:%}
<div n="lb">{#sUryAByudito brahmacArI tizWedaharaBuYjAno'ByastamitaSca rAtriM#}
<div n="lb">{#japansAvitrIm#}. The comm. on the {%Amarak.,%} however, ap-
<div n="lb">pear to have lost sight of this origin of the meanings ‘asleep
<div n="lb">at sunset’ and ‘at sunrise’ of the named words, for {%Rā-%}
<div n="lb">{%yamuk.%} e. g. gives the etymological meaning of {#aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#nirmukta#} ‘completely free from feeling, evening work or de-
<div n="lb">sign, i. e. completely insensible or disengaged’: {#aBi sarva-#}
<div n="lb">{#to BAvena sAyantanena karmaRA niScayena muktaH;#} and he explains
<div n="lb">{#aByudita#} as a deriv. of {#aByudita#} with taddh. aff. {#ac,#} re-
<div n="lb">ferring it to the {%Gaṇa%} to {%Pāṇ.%} V. 2. 127., when its literal
<div n="lb">meaning would be ‘having a sunrise’: {#aByuditamaByudayaH sU-#}
<div n="lb">{#ryasya tadyogAdarSaAdyac . BuktA brAhmaRA itivat#} (comp. {%Siddh.%}
<div n="lb">{%Kaum.%} fol. 186{%a,%} 1. 11).] E. {#muc#} with {#nir#} and {#aBi,#} kṛt
<div n="lb">aff. {#kta#}.
<LEND>

<L>6087<pc>249-a<k1>aBiniveSa<k2>aBiniveSa
{#aBiniveSa#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-SaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Application of thought, lean-
<div n="lb">ing towards, attachment; e. g. {%Yājnav.:%} {#evaMvftto'vinItA-#}
<div n="lb">{#tmA vitaTABiniveSavAn#} ({%Mit.:%} {#vitaº = asatkAryABinive-#}
<div n="lb">{#SavAn;#} comp. {#aBiniveSin#}); or {%Manu:%} {#paradravyezvaBiDyAnaM#}
<div n="lb">{#manasAnizwacintanam . vitaTABiniveSaSca triviDaM karma mAnasam#}
<div n="lb">({%Kullūka:%} {#vitaº nAsti paralokaH . deha evAtmeti;#} {%Medhā-%}
<div n="lb">{%tithi:%} {#pUrvapakzasya sidDAntatvena grahaRam,#} i. e. adhering to false
<div n="lb">doctrines); or {%Śakunt.:%} {#baliaMkKu me ahiRiveso#} (i. e. {#ba-#}
<div n="lb">{#lIyAnKalu me'BiniveSaH#}); {%comm.%} {#ahiº = aBilAzaH,#} i. e.
<div n="lb">my attachment is indeed very strong; or {%Kāśikā:%} {#kalyARe#}
<div n="lb">{#'BiniveSaH,#} or {#pApe'BiniveSaH#}. <sup>2</sup> Intentness, determination
<div n="lb">of purpose, determined resolution, tenacity; e. g. {%Kumāra-%}
<div n="lb">{%sambh.:%} {#aTAnurUpABiniveSatoziRA kftAByujYA guruRA garI-#}
<div n="lb">{#yasA…jagAma gOrI SiKaraM SiKaRqivat#} (quoted also by
<div n="lb">{%Vyāḍi%} on {%Hemach.%} 6. 136. or v. 1500.; {%Mallin.:%} {#aBiº = A-#}
<div n="lb">{#graha#}); or {%Śisupālab.:%} {#apetayudDABiniveSasOmyo harirhariprasTa-#}
<div n="lb">{#maTa pratasTe#} ({%Mallin.:%} = {#apeto yudDe'BiniveSa Agraho yasya#}
<div n="lb">{#sa SAntakroDa ityarTaH#}); or {%Raghuv.:%} {#…janakAtmajAyAM ni-#}
<div n="lb">{#tAntarUkzABiniveSamISam . na kaScana BrAtfzu tezu Sakto nize-#}
<div n="lb">{#dDumAsIt;#} or {%Prabodhach.:%} {#tato devyA#} (scil. {#vizRuBaktyA#})
<div n="lb">{#samupajAtABiniveSamuktam#} ({%comm.:%} = {#utpannaH…aBimA-#}
<div n="lb">{#no yatra yasyAM kriyAyAM yaTA syAttaTA,#} i. e. after having
<div n="lb">taking a proper resolution). <sup>3</sup> (In the {%Yoga%} philosophy.)
<div n="lb">The instinctive (but unjustifiable) clinging to life and bodily
<div n="lb">enjoyment, (‘which is alike in the unthinking worm as in
<div n="lb">the wise man’); it is one of the five {#kleSAH#} ({%Yoga Sūtra:%}
<div n="lb">{#avidyAsmitArAgadvezABiniveSAH paYca kleSAH#}) or afflictions
<div n="lb">of mind which impede the apprehension of true knowledge;
<div n="lb">comp. {#viparyaya#}. ({%Yoga Sūtra:%} {#svarasavAhI viduzo'pi taTA#}
<div n="lb">{#rUQo#}--{%v. l.%} but apparently less correct: {#viduzo'pi tanva-#}
[Page249-b+ 56]
<div n="lb">{#nubanDo--'BiniveSaH;#} a comm.: {#sarvasya prARina iyamAtmA-#}
<div n="lb">{#SIrnityA Bavati . mA na BUvaM BUyAsamiti . na cAnanuBUtamara-#}
<div n="lb">{#RaDarmakasyEzA BavatyAtmASIH . etayA ca pUrvajanmAnuBavaH pratI-#}
<div n="lb">{#yate . sa cAyamaBiniveSaH kleSaH svarasavAhI kfmerapi jAtamA-#}
<div n="lb">{#trasya pratyakzAnumAnAgamErasaMBAvito maraRatrAsa ucCedadfzwyAtmakaH#}
<div n="lb">{#pUrvajanmAnuBUtaM maraRaduHKamanumApayati . yaTA cAyamatyantarUQezu#}
<div n="lb">{#dfSyate kleSastaTA viduzo'pi vijYAtapUrvAparAntasya rUQaH#} &c.;
<div n="lb">{%Bhojadeva:%} {#svasya rasena saMskAreREva vahatIti svarasavAhI . pUrva-#}
<div n="lb">{#janmAnuBUtamaraRaduHKAnuBavavAsanAbalAdBayarUpaH samupajAyamAnaH#}
<div n="lb">{#SarIravizayAdiBirmama viyogo mA BUdityanvahamanubanDarUpaH#}
<div n="lb">{#sarvasyEvA kfmerbrahmaparyantaM#} (from the worm up to Brahmā) {#ni-#}
<div n="lb">{#mittaM vinA pravartamAno'BiniveSAKyaH kleSaH;#} {%Mallinātha%} is
<div n="lb">therefore wrong in his philosophical explanation on {%Sīsupāl.%}

<L>6093<pc>249-b<k1>aBinizwAna<k2>aBinizwAna
{#aBinizwAna#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-naH#}) <sup>1</sup> A sound (esp. a vowel) of the
<div n="lb">alphabet in general; e. g. {%Gobhila-Gṛhya S.:%} {#GozavadAdyantara-#}
<div n="lb">{#ntasTaM dIrGABinizwAnAntaM kftaM nAma daDyAdetadatadDitamayugdAntaM#}
<div n="lb">{#strIRAm;#} (comp. {%Manu%} 2. 33.). <sup>2</sup> The {%Visarga;%} e. g. {%Āsvalāy.%}
<div n="lb">{%Gṛhya S.:%} {#nAma cAsmE dadyurGozavadAdyantarantasTamaBinizwAnAntaM#}
<div n="lb">{#dvyakzaraM caturakzaraM vA dvyakzaraM pratizWAkAmaScaturakzaraM brahmavarcasakAmaH#}
<div n="lb">{#yugmAni tvevaM puMsAmayujAni strIRAm;#} ({%Nārāyaṇa%} explains:
<div n="lb">{#aBinizwAno visarjanIyaH . so'nte yasya tattaToktam#} &c., and
<div n="lb">exemplifies this injunction by the male names: {#rudradevaH, nA-#}
<div n="lb">{#gadevaH, BadradattaH, devadattaH, SivadattaH, devasvAmI, vasuSarmA, ja-#}
<div n="lb">{#nArdanaH, devaGozaH, purandaraH, vizRuSarmA,#} and by the female
<div n="lb">names: {#suBadrA, sAvitrI, satyadA, vasudA;#} comp. s. v. {#nAmaka-#}
[Page250-a+ 56]
<div n="lb">{#raRa#}).--[The reading {#aBinizWAna#} which occurs in Mss., is
<div n="lb">incorrect.--The Pandits who have published {%Pāṇini,%} supply
<div n="lb">in their comm. on VIII. 3. 86. the word {#anyatarasyAm (= vA)#}
<div n="lb">from the preceding Sūtra, and construe thus, besides {#aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#nizwAna,#} an optional form {#aBinistAna;#} {%Patanjali%} and his
<div n="lb">comm. have no gloss on this Sūtra, but neither the {%Kāśikā%}
<div n="lb">nor the {%Siddhāntak.%} admit of an option in the Sūtra 86., nor
<div n="lb">is a form {#aBinistAna#} given by these works or in the {%Dhātu-%}
<div n="lb">comm. of {%Mādhava, Maitreya%} &c., or in the {%Dhātupārāyaṇa%} of
<div n="lb">{%Hemach.%} s. r. {#stan#}.] E. {#stan#} with {#nis#} and {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#GaY#}.
<LEND>

<L>6100<pc>250-a<k1>aBinihita<k2>aBinihita
{#aBinihita#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) Suppressed.--{#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#Binihita#} is called <sup>a.</sup> in the {%Ṛgv.-Prātiś.%} the {#sanDi#} (q. v.)
<div n="lb">which is produced when the vowel {#a#} in the beginning of
<div n="lb">a word is suppressed after a final {#o#} or {#e;#} <sup>b.</sup> in the {%Ṛgv.-,%}
<div n="lb">{%Vājas.-%} and {%Atharv.-Prātiśākhyas%} the {#svarita#} (q. v.) which
<div n="lb">is produced in consequence of an {%anudātta%} {#a#} (in the be-
<div n="lb">ginning of a word) being suppressed after a final {%udātta%} {#o#}
<div n="lb">or {#e#}. The {%Taittir.-Prāt.%} calls the latter {#aBinihata#} (acc. to
<div n="lb">{%Weber, Ind. Stud.%} IV. p. 135). E. {#DA#} with {#ni#} and {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#kta#}.
<LEND>

<L>6101<pc>250-a<k1>aBinihnava<k2>aBinihnava
{#aBinihnava#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-vaH#}) Denial.--{#nihnava#} and {#aBini-#}
<div n="lb">{#hnava (nihnavABinihnavO)#} are the ritual names of the verses
<div n="lb">of the {%Araṇyagāna%} V. 2. 21. and 22. (not met with in the
<div n="lb">{%Sāmaveda;%} acc. to {%Benfey'%}s careful compilation in {%Weber'%}s
<div n="lb">{%Ind. Stud.%} III. p. 222). E. {#aBi#} and {#nihnava#} or {#hnu#} with {#ni#}
<div n="lb">and {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#ap#}.
<LEND>

<L>6102<pc>250-a<k1>aBinIta<k2>aBinIta
{#aBinIta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) <sup>1</sup> Brought near or
<div n="lb">towards; e. g. (fig., to the understanding, intelligible) in a
<div n="lb">quotation of {%Jayam.%} on the {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#BAvikatvamiti prAhuH#}
<div n="lb">{#prabanDavizayaM guRam . pratyakzA iva dfSyante yatrArTA BUtaBAvinaH .#}
<div n="lb">{#citrodAttAdButArTatvaM kaTAyA svaBinItatA#} ({%its easy under-%}
<div n="lb">{%standing%}) {# . SabdAnukulatA ceti tasya hetuM pracakzate#}. <sup>2</sup> Performed
<div n="lb">(as a drama). <sup>3</sup> Fit, proper, suitable; e. g. {%Mah. Śāntip.:%}
<div n="lb">{#asminneva prakaraRe DanaMjayamudAraDIH . aBinItataraM vAkyami-#}
<div n="lb">{#tyuvAca yuDizWiraH#}. <sup>4</sup> Highly ornamented or finished. <sup>5</sup> Even-
<div n="lb">minded, placid, patient. <sup>6</sup> Impatient. [The two latter
<div n="lb">meanings arise from the different manner in which the
<div n="lb">verse of the {%Amarak.:%} {#yukte'tisaMskfte marziRyaBinIto#} &c.
<div n="lb">may be read, viz. either {#ºte marziRi#} or {#te'marziRi;#} hence
<div n="lb">{%Bharata, Subhūti, Ramānātha%} &c. = {#akroDana#} (or {#akroDa#})
<div n="lb">or = {#akzamAvat;#} {%Bhanūd.,%} however, only = {#kzantf#} (i. e.
[Page250-b+ 56]
<div n="lb">{#marzin#}); other Koshas have only the meaning ‘impatient’;
<div n="lb">e. g. {%Medinī, Śabdaratnāv.:%} = {#amarzin,#} {%Ajayapāla:%} = {#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#marzavat,#} probably also {%Jaṭādhara:%} {#aBinItastrizu nyAyye#}
<div n="lb">{#saMskfte'marzavatyapi;#} and {%Hemachandra'%}s {#aBinItastu nyAyye ma-#}
<div n="lb">{#rziRi saMskfte#} is probably also to be read {#nyAyye'maº,#}
<div n="lb">for the {%Viśvaprak.%} explains: {#aBinIto BavennyAyye saMskftA-#}
<div n="lb">{#marziRorapi#}. The meaning ‘placid’ seems more congenial
<div n="lb">with the other meanings of the word; and the meaning
<div n="lb">‘impatient’ refers perhaps to an E. {#a#} neg. and {#BinIta#}--
<div n="lb">compare {#vinIta#} and the Pref. on the particle {#aBi#}--.]
<div n="lb"><sup>7</sup> Friendly, kind ({%Wilson%}). E. {#nI#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#kta#}.
<LEND>

<L>6108<pc>250-b<k1>aBinna<k2>aBinna
{#aBinna#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-nnaH-nnA-nnam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not cut, not
<div n="lb">rent, not broken; e. g. {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#virugnodagraDArAgraH kuli-#}
<div n="lb">{#So mama#} (i. e. of Rāvaṇa) {#vakzasi . aBinnaM SataDAtmAnaM manyate#}
<div n="lb">{#balinaM balI;#} or {#jalaniDimagaman…salilasamudayErmahAtara-#}
<div n="lb">{#NgErBuvanaBarakzamamapyaBinnavelam;#} or {%Ṛgv.:%} {#indro…BUyoBUyo#}
<div n="lb">{#rayimidasya varDayannaBinne Kilye ni daDAti devayum#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%}
<div n="lb">{#aBinne SatruBiraBedye Kilye…anyErgantumaSakye sTale,#} i. e.
<div n="lb">impenetrable). <sup>2</sup> Undivided, one; e. g. (Brahman) {%Śaṅkara%}
<div n="lb">in the comm. on the {%Taittir.-Up.:%} {#asO yo'yamekamaBinna-#}
<div n="lb">{#mAtmatattvaM na paSyati#} &c.; or (the Soul in) a quotation from
<div n="lb">the Buddhists by {%Vijnānāch.%} on the {%Sāṅkhya-Prav.:%} {#aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#nno'pi budDyAtmA viparyAsanidarSanEH . grAhyagrAhakasaMvittiBeda-#}
<div n="lb">{#vAniva lakzyate#}. <sup>3</sup> Not different, same, identical; e. g. {%Pra-%}
<div n="lb">{%bodhach.:%} {#paSyAmi yogAYjanaSudDadarSano jaganmiTo BinnamaBinna-#}
<div n="lb">{#mISvarAt;#} or {%Bharatas.%} on the {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#SlizwamizwamanekArTa-#}
<div n="lb">{#mekarUpAnvitaM vacaH . tadaBinnapadaM BinnapadaM BinnapadaprAyamiti dviDA#}.
<div n="P">2. m. ({#-nnaH#}) (In Arithmetic.) An integer, a whole number.
<div n="lb">E. {#a#} neg. and {#Binna#}.
<LEND>

<L>6113<pc>251-a<k1>aBinnapadaSlizwa<k2>aBinnapadaSlizwa
{#aBinnapadaSlizwa#}¦ Karmadh. n. ({#-zwam#}) (In Rhetoric.) A species
<div n="lb">of paronomasia, considered as an {#alaNkAra#} (q. v.) or elegant
<div n="lb">mode of expression, viz. a connexion of words which ad-
<div n="lb">mit of a double interpretation, the sentence consisting chiefly
<div n="lb">of {%such%} words (and not of words which would admit but
<div n="lb">of one sense); an instance is the following verse of the
<div n="lb">{%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#BuvanaBarasahAnalaNGyaDAmnaH pururuciratnaBfto gurUrude-#}
<div n="lb">{#hAn . SramaviDuravilInakUrmanakrAndaDatamudUQaBuvo girInahIMSca#}
<div n="lb">(scil. {#jalaniDimagaman#}), where all the compounds are at-
<div n="lb">tributes as well of {#girIn#} as of {#ahIn,#} according to the
<div n="lb">double sense in which they may be taken. See {#Slizwa#} or
<div n="lb">{#Sleza#}. E. {#aBinna-pada#} and {#Slizwa#}.
<LEND>

<L>6114<pc>251-a<k1>aBinnaparikarmAzwaka<k2>aBinnaparikarmAzwaka
{#aBinnaparikarmAzwaka#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-kam#}) (In Algebra.) The eight
<div n="lb">elementary operations (of addition, subtraction, multipli-
<div n="lb">cation, division, square, square-root, cube and cube-root)
<div n="lb">as applicable to whole numbers; comp. {#BinnaparikarmAzwaka#}
<div n="lb">(these operations applied to fractions). E. {#aBinna-pari-#}
<div n="lb">{#karman#} and {#azwaka#}.
<LEND>

<L>6115<pc>251-a<k1>aBinyAsa<k2>aBinyAsa
{#aBinyAsa#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-saH#}) (Literally: Combination, mix-
<div n="lb">ture; esp. in Medicine.) A variety of fever, viz. a mixed
<div n="lb">remittent or synochus fever, supposed to be produced by
<div n="lb">the morbid state of the three temperamental elements, air,
<div n="lb">bile and phlegm collectively; the patient is described by
<div n="lb">{%Suśruta%} as ‘being neither too warm nor too cold, not quite
<div n="lb">conscious, wandering in his mind, hoarse, with a sharp
<div n="lb">taste, dry throat, void of perspiration and not having the
<div n="lb">natural excretions, hiccupping, without appetite, dull, pant-
<div n="lb">ing (or sighing), lying prostrate, impeded in speech, drowsy
<div n="lb">and with contracted limbs’; the cure of this fever is believed
<div n="lb">either very difficult or impossible. It is also called {#hatOjas,#}
<div n="lb">as the patient looses his strength by this fever, or from the
<div n="lb">‘combination’ of the causes which produce it, {#sannipAtajvara,#}
<div n="lb">{#sarvAtmakajvara, sarvadozasamutTajvara, sarvajajvara, sarvajvara#}. E.
<div n="lb">{#as#} (cl. 4.) with {#ni#} and {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#GaY;#} scil. {#jvara#}.
<LEND>

<L>6116<pc>251-a<k1>aBinyAsajvara<k2>aBinyAsajvara
{#aBinyAsajvara#}¦ Karmadh. or Tatpur. m. ({#-raH#}) The same as
<div n="lb">the preceding. E. {#aBinyAsa#} and {#jvara#}.
<LEND>

<L>6122<pc>251-b<k1>aBipatti<k2>aBipatti
{#aBipatti#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-ttiH#}) Approaching, coming near; e. g.

<L>6123<pc>251-b<k1>aBipadma<k2>aBipadma
{#aBipadma#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-dmaH-dmA-dmam#}) <sup>1</sup> Every where beau-
<div n="lb">tiful, beautiful in every part of the body. <sup>2</sup> Covered or
<div n="lb">adorned with a lotus flower; comp. {#padmalAYCana#}. [Both in-
<div n="lb">terpretations of this word are given by the comm. on the
<div n="lb">{%Ādip.%} of the {%Mahābh.%} v. 7013: {#dfzwvA tu tAnmattagajendrarUpAmpa-#}
<div n="lb">{#YcABipadmAniva vAraRendrAn;#} {%Nīlak.:%} {#aBitaH padmA lakzmIryezAM#}
<div n="lb">{#tAn . sarvANgasundarAnityarTaH;#} {%Arjunam.:%} = {#padmavinduyutAn;#}
<div n="lb">both comm. mention moreover, instead of {#aBipadmAn,#} a
<div n="lb">{%v. l.%} {#atipadmAn#} which {%Nīlak.%} interprets in the same sense:
<div n="lb">{#atipadmAniti pAWe sa evArTaH,#} but {%Arjunam.:%} {#padmaH puRqarI-#}
<div n="lb">{#kanAmA diggajaH . tasmAdatiSayAnityarTaH,#} i. e. ‘surpassing the
<div n="lb">elephant-atlas Padma (= Puṇḍarīka)’; {%Nīlak.%} mentions, be-
<div n="lb">sides, a bad {%v. l.%} {#atimattAn#}.] E. 1. {#aBi#} and {#padmA,#} 2. {#aBi#}
<div n="lb">and {#padma#}.
<LEND>

<L>6124<pc>251-b<k1>aBipanna<k2>aBipanna
{#aBipanna#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-nnaH-nnA-nnam#}) <sup>1</sup> Come near, run
<div n="lb">towards; ({%Viśvapr., Śabdaratn., Ajayap., Bhūripray.:%} = {#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#Bidruta#}). <sup>2</sup> Seeking refuge ({%Med., Hemach., Trikāṇḍ.:%} = {#Sa-#}
<div n="lb">{#raRArTin#}). <sup>3</sup> Approached by (with a friendly purpose),
<div n="lb">protected, saved; e. g. {%Ādip.%} of the {%Mahābh.:%} {#yatra rAjA#}
<div n="lb">{#kuruSrezWaH parIkzinnAma vE#} ({%v. l.%} {#sa#}) {#dvija . takzakeRa BujaNgena Da-#}
<div n="lb">{#kzyate kila so'dya vE#} ({%v. l.%} {#kila tatra vE#}) {#. gacCAmyahaM#} (i. e.
<div n="lb">Kāśyapa) {#taM tvaritaH sadyaH kartumapajvaram . mayABipannaM#} ({%Nīlak.:%}
<div n="lb">= {#trAtaM#}) {#taM cApi na sarpo Darzayizyati;#} or {%Suśruta:%} {#tadidaM ba-#}
<div n="lb">{#hugUQArTaM cikitsAvIjamIritam . kuSalenABipannaM#} (i. e. culti-
<div n="lb">vated by a clever physician) {#tadvahuDABiprarohati#}. <sup>3</sup> Obtained,
<div n="lb">appropriated; ({%Ajayap.:%} = {#svIkfta,#} {%Śabdamuktām.:%} = {#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#NgIkfta#}). <sup>4</sup> Overcome, afflicted; ({%Amarak., Med., Ajayap.:%}
<div n="lb">= {#aBigrasta;#} {%Viśvapr., Śabdaratn., Bhūripr.:%} = {#grasta#}); e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Suśruta:%} {#vAtABipanne nayane,#} or {#pittABipanne nayane,#} or {#kaPA-#}
<div n="lb">{#Bipanne nayane,#} or {#dfzwirdozABipannA,#} or {#PenaM ca prasfjati tatsa-#}
<div n="lb">{#KABipannaH#} (i. e. one possessed by the Skandāpasmāra).
<div n="lb"><sup>5</sup> Unfortunate, calamitous ({%Amarak., Med.:%} = {#Apadgata,#} {%Vi-%}
<div n="lb">{%śvapr., Śabdaratn., Bhūripr.:%} = {#vipadgata#}). <sup>6</sup> Guilty ({%Ama-%}
<div n="lb">{%rak., Med.%} &c. = {#aparAdDa#}). <sup>7</sup> Far, remote ({%Ajayap.:%} = {#vi-#}
<div n="lb">{#prakfzwa,#} {%Śabdamuktām.:%} = {#dUra#}). <sup>8</sup> Dead, deceased (i. e. gone
<div n="lb">forth; comp. {#preta#}); e. g. {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#svaBAvahInErmfgapakziGozEH#}
<div n="lb">{#krandanti BartAramivABipannam#} ({%Jayam., Bharatas.%} &c.: {#aBipannaM#}
<div n="lb">{#= mftam#}). E. {#pad#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#kta#}.
<LEND>

<L>6127<pc>252-a<k1>aBipitva<k2>aBipitva
{#aBipitva#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-tvam#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> Approach, arrival; e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Ṛgv.:%} {#kuha sviddozA kuha vastoraSvinA kuhABipitvaM karataH#}
<div n="lb">({%Yāska:%} = {#kvABiprAptiM kuruTaH#}); or {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Atharv.:%} {#tasmA#}
<div n="lb">{#idanDaH suzumA sudakzamihABipitvaM karate gfRAnaH#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%}
<div n="lb">= {#asmadaBimataprAptiM karotu#}). <sup>2</sup> Approach (of the day), day-
<div n="lb">break, dawn; e. g. {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Sāmav.:%} {#divABipitve'vasA-#}
<div n="lb">{#gamizWA#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} = {#divasasyABipatane prAtaHkAle#}). <sup>3</sup> An oc-
<div n="lb">casion to be approached or observed, a solemnity, a sacri-
<div n="lb">fice; e. g. {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Atharv.:%} {#indro'Bipitvezu raRyati#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%}
<div n="lb">{#tasya pUrvoktasya sarvasyABipitvezvaBiprAptizvindro raRyati . ra-#}
<div n="lb">{#mate . yadvA pUrvoktAnAM barhirAdInAmaBiprAptizu#} &c.); or {%Ṛgv.:%}
<div n="lb">{#uta na IM tvazwA gantvacCA smatsUriBiraBipitve sajozAH#} ({%Sā-%}
<div n="lb">{%yaṇa:%} {#aBipitve'Bigantavye yajYe#}); or {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Vājas.:%} {#api#}
<div n="lb">{#yaTA yuvAno matsaTA no viSvaM jagadaBipitve manIzA#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%}
<div n="lb">{#aBipitve'BipatanIye'smadyajYe;#} {%Mahīdh.%} however gives to
<div n="lb">the word in this verse the meaning 1., viz. = {#aBipatane#}
<div n="lb">{#AgamanakAle#}). <sup>4</sup> A place to be gone to; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#ASu-#}
<div n="lb">{#ScanedaBipitvaM jagAma#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} = {#aBiprAptavyameva jagAma#}). <sup>5</sup> A
<div n="lb">near time, a proximate occasion; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#sanatkakzIvAM~#}
<div n="lb">{#aBipitve ahnAm#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#divasAnAM maDye'Bipitve saMni-#}
<div n="lb">{#hite'hani sanat…aBipitvaSabda AsannakAlavAcI prapi-#}
<div n="lb">{#tvaSabda itivat#}). <sup>6</sup> Any thing obtained (e. g. wealth); e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Ṛgv.:%} {#vfkzAScinme aBipitve arAraRuH#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#me mayABi-#}
<div n="lb">{#pitve pUrvokte Dane'BiprApte sati#} &c.). <sup>7</sup> Departure, decline
<div n="lb">of the day; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#A vaH pItayo'Bipitve'hnAmimA#}
<div n="lb">{#astaM navasvaH iva gman#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#ahnAmaBipitve'Bipatane sa-#}
<div n="lb">{#mAptO#}); or {%Ṛgv.:%} {#yo vaH sunotyaBipitve ahnAm#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%}
<div n="lb">{#ahnAmaBipitve'Bipatane tftIyasavana ityarTaH#}). E. {#Ap#} with
<div n="lb">{#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#tvan;#} but see the E. of {#apapitva#}.
<LEND>

<L>6154<pc>253-a<k1>aBiprAya<k2>aBiprAya
{#aBiprAya#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-yaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Intention, purpose, design; e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Rāmāy.:%} {#nABiprAyamaBijYAya mamEvaM vaktumarhasi;#} or {%Nyāya S.:%}
<div n="lb">{#aviSezABihite'rTe vakturaBiprAyAdarTAntarakalpanA vAkCalam;#}
<div n="lb">or {%Vijnānabh.:%} {#yacCAstrezu SarIradvayameva SrUyate talliNgaSarI-#}
<div n="lb">{#rADizWAnaSarIrayoranyonyaniyatatvena sUkzmatvena cEkatABiprAyA-#}
<div n="lb">{#diti#} ‘because their oneness is meant to be conveyed by
<div n="lb">&c.’; or {%Daṇḍin%} (as quoted by {%Jayam.%}): {#taM BAvikamiti#}
<div n="lb">{#prAhuH prabanDavizayaM guRam . BAvaH kaveraBiprAyaH kAvyezvAsIdvya-#}
<div n="lb">{#vasTitaH;#} or {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#yadyakalpsyadaBiprAyo yodDuM rakzaHpateH sva-#}
<div n="lb">{#yam#} &c. <sup>2</sup> ‘Goal’: a name or epithet of Viṣṇu; the 871st of
<div n="lb">his thousand names in the {%Anuśāsanap.%} of the {%Mahābh.;%} be-
<div n="lb">cause he is the goal of the world which is finally merged
<div n="lb">in him: {%Mahābh.:%} {#aBiprAyo priyArho'rhaH#} &c. ({%Gaṅgādhara:%}
<div n="lb">{#puruzArTecCuBirnityamaBipreyata ityasO . ABimuKyenAtra jagatprEti#}
<div n="lb">{#kAle'Ta lIyate#}). <sup>3</sup> Opinion, belief, meaning; e. g. {%Sāhityad.:%}
<div n="lb">{#kecittu karmaRi kuSala iti rUQAvudAharanti . tezAmayamaBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#prAyaH . kuSaM lAti . iti vyutpattilaByaH kuSagrAhirUpo muKyo#}
<div n="lb">{#'rTaH…dakzarUpamarTaM boDayati;#} or {%Bharatas.%} on the
<div n="lb">{%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#BfNgaH…tAM dadaMSa . yataH karaM dfzwvA raktapadmami-#}
<div n="lb">{#tyaBisaMDiraBiprAyo yasya#} &c.; or {%Manu:%} {#tezAM svaM svamaBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#prAyamupalaBya pfTakpfTak . samastAnAM ca kAryezu vidaDyAdDita-#}
<div n="lb">{#mAtmanaH#}. <sup>4</sup> Motive, reason, consideration; e. g. {%Jaiminīya-%}
<div n="lb">{%nyāyam.:%} {#pUjyAnAM pratyakzanAmagrahaRamayuktamityaBiprAyeRa#} (from
<div n="lb">this reason) {#hUtaSabdasTAne hotfSabdaH paWyate;#} or {%Jayam.%} on
<div n="lb">the {%Bhaṭṭik.%} {#(aboDi duHsTaM trElokyam): trElokyaM nihanmi#}
<div n="lb">{#yasminhanyamAne'pi sItAdruho'pi naSyanti . ityaBiprAyeRa#}
<div n="lb">(from this reason) {#duHsTamaboDi;#} or {%Ved. Sāra:%} {#idamajYAnaM#}
<div n="lb">{#samazwivyazwyaBiprAyeRa#} ({%through the consideration of its being%}
<div n="lb">{%taken collectively or separately%}) {#ekamanekamiti ca vyavahriyate .#}
<div n="lb">{#taTA hi yaTA vfkzARAM samazwyaBiprAyeRa vanamityekatvavyapadeSaH#}
<div n="lb">&c. <sup>5</sup> Implied sense, bearing of a word, of a sentence &c.
<div n="lb">(used in the same way as {#BAva,#} and in distinction from
<div n="lb">{#arTa,#} the obvious or literal sense of a word &c.); e. g. {%Dā-%}
<div n="lb">{%yabh.:%} {#vizRuvacane ca banDupadaM mAtulAdyABiprAyam;#} or {%Sāyaṇa%}
<div n="lb">(in the comm. on the {%Ṛgv.%}): {#gAmaSvamitijAtyaBiprAyameka-#}
<div n="lb">{#vacanam;#} or {%Bharatas.%} on the {%Bhaṭṭik.%} (1. 6.): {#viSvakarmaRA#}
<div n="lb">{#nedfSI SoBanA purI nirmitA . ata imAM vilokyedfkpurI-#}
<div n="lb">{#nirmARe cezwA jAtetyaBiprAyaH#}. <sup>6</sup> Reference, relation; e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Pāṇini:%} {#svaritaYitaH kartraBiprAye kriyAPale#} ({%Kāśikā:%} {#kartAraM#}
<div n="lb">{#cetkriyAPalamaBiprEti#}). <sup>7</sup> Any thing meant or intended, but
[Page253-b+ 56]
<div n="lb">not real, a semblance; e. g. {%Ṛgv. Prātiś.:%} {#vivfttyaBiprAyezu#}
<div n="lb">{#ca pIvo annAM~ rayivfDaH#} ‘amongst the semblances of hiatus’
<div n="lb">(i. e. amongst sandhis of final vowels and beginning semi-
<div n="lb">vowels, which are not real hiatus, but may be considered
<div n="lb">as such); or {#…aBiprAyAMSca paripAdayanti#}. E. {#i#} with
<div n="lb">{#pra#} and {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#GaY#}.
<LEND>

<L>6161<pc>253-b<k1>aBiplava<k2>aBiplava
{#aBiplava#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-vaH#}) A religious act, forming part of
<div n="lb">the sacrifice {#gavAmayana#} (q. v.) and consisting of ceremonies
<div n="lb">which last six days; the ceremony of the first and sixth of
<div n="lb">these days is called {#jyotis,#} of the second and fourth {#go,#}
<div n="lb">of the third and fifth {#Ayus#} ({%Kalpavyākhyā:%} {#jyotirgOrA-#}
<div n="lb">{#yurgOrAyurjyotiriti zaqaho'Biplava ityucyate#}); the {#aBiplava#}
<div n="lb">recurs several times at the various stages of the Gavā-
<div n="lb">mayana and bears its name, according to a legend of the
<div n="lb">{%Śatapatha-Br.,%} because the Ādityās, rivalling with the Angi-
<div n="lb">rasas in the precedence of getting into the paradise, {%jumped%}
<div n="lb">into it by means of the hymns which occur in this ceremony
<div n="lb">{#‘aTAdityASca ha vA aNgirasaSca . uBaye prAjApatyA asparDanta#}
<div n="lb">{#vayaM pUrve svargaM lokamezyAmo vayaM pUrva iti . ta AdityAH . ca-#}
<div n="lb">{#turBi stomEScaturBiH pfzWErlaGuBiH sAmaBiH svargaM lokamaByaplavanta#}
<div n="lb">{#yadaByaplavanta tasmAdaBiplavAH’#}. E. {#plu#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#ap#}.
<LEND>

<L>6174<pc>254-b<k1>aBiBAyatana<k2>aBiBAyatana
{#aBiBAyatana#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) (In Buddhistic doctrine.) ‘The
<div n="lb">basis of mastership or superiority’; {#aBiBAyatanAni#} or the
<div n="lb">(eight) bases of superiority are the (eight) mental accom-
<div n="lb">plishments or superior powers of a man who by having
<div n="lb">internally the {%idea of form,%} perceives externally <sup>1</sup> {%limited%} or
<div n="lb"><sup>2</sup> {%illimited forms,%} either {%with agreeable%} or {%disagreeable colours,%}
<div n="lb">by having internally the {%idea of absence of form%} perceives
<div n="lb">externally <sup>3</sup> {%limited%} or <sup>4</sup> {%illimited forms,%} either, too, {%with%}
<div n="lb">{%agreeable%} or {%disagreeable colours,%} and by having internally
<div n="lb">the {%idea of absence of form%} perceives externally <sup>5</sup> {%dark-blue%}
<div n="lb">{%forms with dark-blue colours, aspect or appearance, <sup>6</sup> yellow%}
<div n="lb">{%forms with yellow colours, aspect or appearance, <sup>7</sup> red forms%}
<div n="lb">{%with red colours, aspect or appearance,%} and <sup>8</sup> {%white forms%}
<div n="lb">{%with white colours, aspect or appearance.%} See {%Burnouf's Lo-%}
<div n="lb">{%tus de la bonne loi;%} append. XV. E. {#aBiBA#} 2. and {#Ayatana;#}
<div n="lb">({%Burnouf 1. c.%} considers the word as a {%Pāli%} form represent-
<div n="lb">ing the Sanskṛt {#aBiBvAyatana,#} i. e. {#aBiBu#} or {#aBiBU#} and
<div n="lb">{#Ayatana,#} and renders it accordingly ‘the place or region
<div n="lb">of the {%conqueror%}’; but as {#aBiBA = aBiBUti#} or {#aBiBava#}
<div n="lb">may also have the active meaning, it seems better to adopt
<div n="lb">the given E. and to take the word as a pure Sanskṛt
<div n="lb">compound, meaning ‘that on which victory rests’, and
<div n="lb">similar in formation to the Buddh. {#rUpAyatana#} or {#AkASA-#}
<div n="lb">{#nantyAyatana#}).
<LEND>

<L>6175<pc>254-b<k1>aBiBAra<k2>aBiBAra

<div n="lb">heavy; e. g. {%Śatapath.:%} {#sa vA azwAveva kftvo juhvAM gfhRAti .#}
<div n="lb">{#caturupaBfti tadvajramaBiBAraM karoti#} (thus in {%Weber'%}s ed. III.
<div n="lb">4. 4. 8.; but the E. I. H. Ms. 657 reads in the comm. of {%Sā-%}
<div n="lb">{%yaṇa%} {#tadvajramatiBAraM karoti,#} as mentioned also in the {%various%}
<div n="lb">{%readings%} of that ed.). E. {#aBi#} and {#BAra#}.
<LEND>

<L>6188<pc>255-a<k1>aBiBU<k2>aBiBU

<div n="lb">one of the divinities invoked in the ceremony {#annahoma#} (q. v.)
<div n="lb">of the Aśvamedha sacrifice. E. {#BU#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#kvip#}.

<div n="lb">{#diSaH kalpantAm#} ({%Mahīdh.:%} {#he akza yadvA he yajamAna tvamaBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#BUrasi . aBiBavitA . aBito vyAptAsi#}). E. {#aBi#} and {#BU#}.

<L>6189<pc>255-a<k1>aBiBUta<k2>aBiBUta

<L>6190<pc>255-b<k1>aBiBUti<k2>aBiBUti

<div n="lb">victory; in the Veda also used as epithet of a masc., e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Ṛgv.:%} {#yuvaM SvetaM pedave…adattamaSvam . johutramaryo aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#BUtim#} ‘the horse which is victory (i. e. victorious) over
<div n="lb">the enemy’; or {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Atharv.:%} {#ataH saMgfByABiBUta A Bara#}
<div n="lb">‘(Indra) who is victory i. e. victorious (over the enemies)’.
<div n="lb">Comp. the use of {#aBikzadA;#} but it is possible, too, to refer
<div n="lb">the latter instances to {#aBiBUti#} 2. <sup>3</sup> Disrespect, humiliation.
<div n="P">2. m. f. n. ({#-tiH-tiH-ti#}) (ved.) Overpowering, defeat-
<div n="lb">ing, victorious; e. g. {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Vājas.:%} {#A yAtvindro'vasa#}
<div n="lb">{#upa…dyOrna kzatramaBiBUti puzyAt#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#aBiBUti para-#}
<div n="lb">{#kIyaM balamaBiBAvukaM kzatraM svakIyaM balaM tejo vA puzyAt;#} {%Ma-%}
<div n="lb">{%hīdh.:%} {#kIdfSaM kzatram . aBiBUti . aBiBavanaSIlaM SUram;#} or
<div n="lb">{#yo no durevo vfkatirdaBItistasminmATAmaBiBUtyojaH#} (where
<div n="lb">{#aBiBUti#} and {#ojaH#} are not to be mistaken for a com-
<div n="lb">pound; {%Sāyaṇa:%} {#aBiBUtyaBiBAvukamIjo balam#}). See also

<L>6191<pc>255-b<k1>aBiBUtyojas<k2>aBiBUtyojas

<L>6200<pc>256-a<k1>aBimantos<k2>aBimantos
{#aBimantos#}¦ Tatpur. ind. (ved.) (Probably.) To hurt, to in-
<div n="lb">jure, to destroy, (comp. {%Nīlak.%} s. v. {#man#} with {#aBi#}); e. g.
<div n="lb">{%Śatapath.:%} {#aTa hEka ulmukyena dahanti . tadu taTA na kuryAdeza#}
<div n="lb">{#vE rudriyo'gniH sa hEnamISvaraH saputraM sapaSumaBimantoH#} ‘for it
<div n="lb">is capable to injure (or to destroy) him with his sons and
<div n="lb">cattle’; (for the construction of {#ISvara#} comp. {%Pāṇ.%} III. 4. 13.).
<div n="lb">E. {#man#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#tosun#} (i. e. the genitive of
<div n="lb">an obsolete base {#aBimantu,#} in the sense of the infinitive,
<div n="lb">which in the classical dialect would be {#aBimantum;#} but with
<div n="lb">the udātta on the second syllable, which accent the word
<div n="lb">would not have, if it were the sixth case of a regular word
<div n="lb">{#aBimantu;#} comp. {%Pāṇ.%} VI. 2. 50.).
<LEND>

<L>6202<pc>256-a<k1>aBimantraRamantra<k2>aBimantraRamantra

<L>6203<pc>256-a<k1>aBimantrita<k2>aBimantrita
{#aBimantrita#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) Consecrated, charmed,
<div n="lb">made sacred by a formula pronounced over it; e. g. {%Yama:%}
<div n="lb">{#aNgulyagre sTitaM piRqaM gAyatryA cABimantritam . prASyAcamye-#}
<div n="lb">{#tpunaH kuryAdanyasyApyaBimantraRam;#} or {%Mitākṣ.:%} {#agnimaBimantya#}
<div n="lb">{#taptamayaHpiRqaM saMdaMSena gfhItvA kartraBimantritaM tasyAYjalO nida-#}
<div n="lb">{#DyAt;#} or {%Rāmāyaṇa:%} {#kftasvastyayanaM…maNgalEraBimantritam;#}
<div n="lb">or {%Suśruta:%} {#adBiSca gAyatryaBimantritABiH#} &c. Comp. {#aBi-#}
<div n="lb">{#cArita#}. E. {#mantr#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#kta#}.
<LEND>

<L>6207<pc>256-b<k1>aBimanyu<k2>aBimanyu

<div n="lb">Subhadrā; <sup>c.</sup> A king of Orissa, who reigned after Vichi-
<div n="lb">travīrya (comp. {%Lassen'%}s {%Ind. Alt.%} II. p. 31); <sup>d.</sup> A king of
<div n="lb">Kashmir, who reigned after Nāgārjuna (comp. {%Lassen'%}s {%Ind.%}
<div n="lb">{%Alt.%} II. p. 413); <sup>e.</sup> Another king of Kashmir, who reigned
<div n="lb">after Kshemagupta. E. {#aBi#} and {#manyu#}.

<L>6208<pc>256-b<k1>aBimanyupura<k2>aBimanyupura

<div n="lb">Kashmir: the first founded by Abhimanyu, the successor
<div n="lb">of Nāgārjuna, the second by the wife of Kshemagupta, in
<div n="lb">commemoration of the reign of his successor Abhimanyu.
<div n="lb">E. {#aBimanyu#} and {#pura#}.
<LEND>

<L>6220<pc>257-a<k1>aBimarzaRa<k2>aBimarzaRa

<L>6221<pc>257-a<k1>aBimAti<k2>aBimAti
{#aBimAti#}¦ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-tiH-tiH-ti#}) (ved.) Doing
<div n="lb">injury, hurting, offensive, inimical; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#sa hi zmA#}
<div n="lb">{#viSvacarzaRiraBimAti saho daDe#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#aBimAti SatrURAM#}
<div n="lb">{#hiMsakam#}). E. {#man#} (cl. 4) with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#ktin#}.
<div n="P">II. Tatpur. or Bahuvr. f. m. ({#-tiH-tiH#}) (ved.) A wicked
<div n="lb">man, a foe, an enemy; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#na yaM dipsanti dipsavo#}
<div n="lb">{#na druhvARo janAnAm . na devamaBimAtayaH#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#aBimA-#}
<div n="lb">{#tayaH pApmAnaH . pApmA vA aBimAtiriti SrutyantarAt#}); or
<div n="lb">{%Ṛgv.%} or {%Vājas.:%} {#agne sahasva pftanA aBimAtIrapAsya#} ({%Sā-%}
<div n="lb">{%yaṇa:%} {#aBimAtIrarAtIn…aBito mAnaM yezAM ta iti#}
<div n="lb">{#bahuvrIhO pUrvapadaprakftisvaratvam#}--cf. {%Pāṇ.%} VI. 2. 1.--; {%Ma-%}
<div n="lb">{%hīdh.:%} {#strItvamArzam . aBimatIYCatrUn#}); or {%Ṛgv.%} or {%Sāmav.:%}
<div n="lb">{#mA na staraBimAtaye#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#aBimanyata ityaBimAtiH SatruH#}).
<div n="lb">Comp. {#aBimAtin#}. E. {#man#} (cl. 4), with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff.
<div n="lb">{#ktin,#} or ({%Bahuvr.%}) {#aBi#} and {#mAti#} ({#mA,#} kṛt aff. {#ktin#});
<div n="lb">the latter Etym., according to {%Sāyaṇa,%} but less probable
<div n="lb">than the former alluded to equally by this comm., since the
<div n="lb">accent of the word--udātta on the second syllable--would
<div n="lb">follow not less from {%Pāṇ.%} VI. 2. 2. than from VI. 2. 50.; the use of
<div n="lb">the word in the femin. is considered by {%Mahīdh.,%} in the given
<div n="lb">quotation, as a vaidik archaism, but it is probably more cor-
<div n="lb">rect to assume that the word was originally a {%fem.,%} meaning
<div n="lb">{%injury, hostility,%} and became as such afterwards personified as
<div n="lb">a masc. in the sense {%enemy;%} comp. {#aBikzadA, aBiBUti#} &c.
<LEND>

<L>6230<pc>257-b<k1>aBimAna<k2>aBimAna
{#aBimAna#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-naH#}) <sup>1</sup> (In Philosophy.) Conceiving
<div n="lb">objects with the notion that they refer to one's own self:
<div n="lb">the mental process which is the essential characteristic of
<div n="lb">{#ahaNkAra#} (of the conception of ‘I’ or of the notion of per-
<div n="lb">sonality) q. v.; e. g. {%Sāṅkhya Sūtra:%} {#aBimAno'haMkAraH#}
<div n="lb">({%Vijnānāch.:%} {#ahaM karotItyahaMkAraH kumBakAravat . antaHkara-#}
<div n="lb">{#RadravyaM sa ca DarmaDarmyaBedAdaBimAna ityuktaH#}); or {%Vedānta Sāra:%}
<div n="lb">{#aBimAnAtmikAntaHkaraRavfttirahaMkAraH;#} and therefore in {%cor-%}
<div n="lb">{%rect writing%} not identical with the philosophical term {#ahaM-#}
<div n="lb">{#kAra#} itself, although some authors use both words some-
<div n="lb">times apparently as synonymes: {%Vijnānāch.:%} {#ahaMkAraScABi-#}
<div n="lb">{#mAnavfttikamantaHkaraRadravyaM na tvaBimAnamAtraM dravyasyEva loke#}
<div n="lb">{#dravyopAdAnatvadarSanAt#}. Yet as the notion of personality
<div n="lb">in the orthodox philosophical systems is not our notion
<div n="lb">of self-consciousness, but the notion based on that con-
<div n="lb">dition of the mind which identifies the {%bodily personality%}
<div n="lb">or {%individual existence%} with the Absolute, and as this
<div n="lb">mental condition is held to lead to an erroneous concep-
<div n="lb">tion of the absolute Truth, the terms {#ahaMkAra#} and {#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#BimAna#} have generally a {%negative%} bearing, the latter imply-
<div n="lb">ing: ‘conceiving the {%wrong%} or {%erroneous idea%} that the ob-
<div n="lb">jects of the world refer absolutely to one's own {%bodily%} or
<div n="lb">{%individual%} self’; e. g. {%Viśvan.%} (on the {%Nyāya S.%} {#dozanimi-#}
<div n="lb">{#ttAnAM tatvajYAnAdahaMkAranivfttiH#}): {#ahaMkAro'hamityaBimAnaH#}
<div n="lb">{#sa ca SarIrAdivizayako miTyAjYAnamucyate#} (comp. the {%Sid-%}
<div n="lb">{%dhāntamuktāv.:%} {#ahaMkAro'hamiti pratyayaH . tasyASrayo vizaya#}
<div n="lb">{#Atmani SarIrAdiriti#}); or {%Sāṅkhyatattvak.:%} {#yatKalvAlo-#}
<div n="lb">{#citaM mataM ca tatrAhamaDikftaH . SaktaH Kalvahamatra . madarTA evA-#}
<div n="lb">{#mI vizayAH . matto nAnyo'trADikftaH kaScidastyato'hamasmI-#}
<div n="lb">{#ti yo'BimAnaH so'sADAraRavyApAratvAdahaMkAraH#}. <sup>2</sup> Con-
<div n="lb">ception in general, but (like the preceding meaning) usually
<div n="lb">with an implied {%negative%} bearing: erroneous conception or
<div n="lb">belief, imagination, fancy; e. g. {%Nyāya Sūtras:%} {#sPawikAnya-#}
<div n="lb">{#tvABimAnavattadanyatvABimAnaH#} ‘as crystal is {%fancied%} to be-
<div n="lb">come different (from the proximity with objects it comes
<div n="lb">in contact with) so the mental activity is {%fancied%} to vary’;
<div n="lb">or {#svapnavizayABimAnavadayaM pramARaprameyABimAnaH#} ‘like the
<div n="lb">{%conceit%} of things in a dream, is the {%conceit%} of means of
<div n="lb">proof and objects of proof’; or {#miTyopalabDivinASastattva-#}
<div n="lb">{#jYAnAtsvapnavizayABimAnapraRASavatpratiboDe#} ‘false conception
<div n="lb">ceases through the knowledge of the Truth as the {%imagin-%}
<div n="lb">{%ation%} of objects in a dream vanishes on awaking’; or {%Bho-%}
<div n="lb">{%jadeva%} (on the {%Yoga S.%} {#vivekaKyAtiºº#}): {#pratipakzaBAvanAba-#}
<div n="lb">{#lAdavidyApravilaye nivfttakartftvajYAtftvABimAnAyA rajastamo-#}
<div n="lb">{#malAnaBiBUtAyA budDerantarmuKAyA yA cicCAyAsaMkrAntiH sA#}
<div n="lb">{#vivekaKyAtirityucyate#} ‘…of the intellect in which the con-
[Page258-a+ 56]
<div n="lb">ceit of being agent or knower has ceased…’; or {%Sā-%}
<div n="lb">{%hityad.:%} {#utsAhAdisamudboDaH sADAraRyABimAnataH . nfRAmapi#}
<div n="lb">{#samudrAdilaNGanAdO na duzyati#} ‘…from {%imagining%} that the
<div n="lb">hero of a poem possesses universal powers’. Comp. also
<div n="lb">the inst. s. v. {#aBimanyamAna#}. (This use of the word recon-
<div n="lb">ciles its rendering {#jYAna#} by the {%Amarak., Hem., Bhūripr.%} &c.,
<div n="lb">and {#ajYAna#} by the {%Medinī.%}) <sup>3</sup> Arrogance, self-conceit, pride
<div n="lb">(of family, wealth, superior qualities &c.; {%Ramānātha%} on the
<div n="lb">{%Amarak.:%} {#AdinA kulapaSuguRAdigrahaH#}); comp. {#ahaNkAra;#}
<div n="lb">e. g. {%Śṛṅgāratil.:%} {#prAyo mUrKaH pariBavaviDO nABimAnaM piDatte;#}
<div n="lb">or {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#parAmfSantaH praTitABimAnAH procuH prahastapramuKA#}
<div n="lb">{#daSAsyam#}. <sup>4</sup> Affection, ({%Amarak.%} &c. = {#praRayaH;#} {%Mukuṭa:%}
<div n="lb">= {#prItiH#}). <sup>5</sup> Affectionate solicitation; ({%Ramānātha:%} = {#premRA#}
<div n="lb">{#prArTanam#}). <sup>6</sup> Solicitation in general, wish, desire; ({%Svāmin,%}
<div n="lb">{%Nīlak.:%} = {#prArTanA#}); e. g. {%Vijnānāch.:%} {#mayAnenendriyeRedaM rU-#}
<div n="lb">{#pAdikaM Boktavyamidameva suKasADanamityAdyaBimAnAdevAdisarge-#}
<div n="lb">{#zvindriyatadvizayotpattyAhaMkAra indriyAdihetuH#}. <sup>7</sup> Injury, hurt-
<div n="lb">ing, killing, desire of doing injury &c. ({%Amarak.:%} = {#hiMsA,#}
<div n="lb">{%Bharata:%} = {#hanana;#} {%Sāyaṇa%} on the {%Śatap.:%} = {#hiMsecCA#}). E.
<div n="lb">{#man#} (cl. 4) with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#GaY;#} or in the meanings
<div n="lb">1-3, perhaps {#mA#} with {#aBi,#} kṛt aff. {#lyuw;#} for the affinity
<div n="lb">of both radicals see s. vv.
<LEND>

<L>6231<pc>258-a<k1>aBimAnatA<k2>aBimAnatA
{#aBimAnatA#}¦ f. ({#-tA#}) Pride, arrogance. E. {#aBimAna,#} taddh.
<div n="lb">aff. {#tal#}.
<LEND>

<L>6232<pc>258-a<k1>aBimAnavat<k2>aBimAnavat
{#aBimAnavat#}¦ m. f. n. ({#-vAn-vatI-vat#}) <sup>1</sup> (In Philosophy.)
<div n="lb">Possessing the {#aBimAna#} 1. q. v., consisting of it, (as {#a-#}
<div n="lb">{#haMkAra#}); e. g. {%Vijnānāch.%} (on the {%Sāṅkhya Sūtra:%} {#vAhyABya-#}
<div n="lb">{#ntarAByAM tEScAhaMkArasya#}): {#tanmAtrendriyARyaBimAnavaddravyopAdA-#}
<div n="lb">{#nakAnyaBimAnakAryadravyatvAt#}. <sup>2</sup> Proud, arrogant; e. g. {%Ki-%}
<div n="lb">{%rātārj.:%} {#aBimAnavato manasvinaH priyamuccEH padamArurukzataH#} &c.
<div n="lb">(The word may have also the sense: {%affectionate%} &c., see
<div n="lb">{#aBimAna#} 2. 4-7., but occurs usually only in the two given
<div n="lb">meanings.) E. {#aBimAna,#} taddh. aff. {#matup#}.
<LEND>

<L>6233<pc>258-a<k1>aBimAnavfttika<k2>aBimAnavfttika
